Hermione was sitting firmly upon Harry as the train continued its ongoing journey towards Hogwarts School. She sat with her back against him, deliberately obscuring his vision so he couldn't even look out of the window and watch their progress. In fact he couldn't see very much except her.

It wasn't long though before the other occupant of the carriage, Ron came forward in an attempt to grab his own wand back. The moment Ron left his seat, Hermione slipped Harry's broken glasses off his face and stashed them in her pocket along with the other boy' wand.

Ron made a lunge for that poket, in an attempt to grab his wand from her, but the moment his face came in range Hermione closed her fist and punched him squarely in the gut. She quickly followed that up with a punch to his face and Ron slipped to the floor, winded and with a trickle of blood coming from his nose.

"Stay back Ron, unless you want more" Hermione waned him, she still hadn't moved at all from her seat upon Harry.

Ron didn't listen though, boys never do. He came directly for her with his own fist clenched, not even caring about the fact that she was a girl.
Hermione grabbed his wrist and twished it roughly, spraining it, then she followed up with severa slaps across his face. "If I have to teach you the hard way, I will, she continued her warning "next time I'll put your down." She laid an open hand on his forehead and pushed him backwards, causing him to lose his footing and drop to the floor.

Ron tried one last time but Hermione then delived a sold blow across his jaw that sent one a couple of teeth flying out of his mouth. She hit him again just as hard and he dropped to the ground again. This time he didn't get up. Hermione looked down at him and gave him a satisfied smile. He was out cold.

"What happened? Harry gasped, what was all that commotion. What happened to my glasses."

"Oh that" Hermione shrugged "Ron here wouldn't listen to me so I took steps by hitting him a few times. He's now unconscious on the floor. As for your glasses, Harry. I have them."

"What are you talking about, you've been sitting on me the entire time."

"What's that got to do with it?"

"Why did you take my glasses?"

"Well they could have been damaged, if they'd splintered and a slither of glass had caught you in the eye you could have been blinded completely."

"Oh I see, can I have them back now?"

"No, I'll hold on to them for a while, they were digging into my back. You don't need them anyway since I'm here with you. Trust what Itell you Harry. Ron didn't and now he is sleeping soundly on the floor of the carriage."

She rubbed his hair with one hand as she said this, slipping several strands into place above his eyes and concealing his scar. Now he just looked like any other dark haired boy, and of course he wasn't wearing his glasses.

1113121.content:
It wasn't long after Hermione had put Ron to sleep that a blonde haired boy staggered into their compartment, and almost tripped over Ron in the process. There were two other boys with him, and these looked both muscular and thick. The kind of boys who looked like they could be the perfect cronies.

"I've heard Harry Potter is in this compartment" he drawled "is that true?"

"There's just me and my chair here" Hermione informed him "oh and that lump on the floor that you almost collided with."

Chair? Well, that boy, whoever he was did seem to be acting rather like a chair, the girl was certainly sitting on him as though he was one. Perhaps it was her pet name for him or something else that girls liked to do, he didn't care for girl stuff himself. The boy appeared to have dark hair, but he wasn't wearing glasses as Harry Potter was reputed to do, and there was no sign of that famous scar. He was probably some nobody from nowheresville, and therefore not worthy of his attention. Malfoy was like that, if he didn't think someone was important enough, he tended to either not waste his time on them or gloat about their shortcomings. He decided to stick with the former, for now.

Clearly the rumours about Potter being here were unfounded, but who was this other boy?

He could see that the sleeping lad had red hair and freckles though, there was blood on his face and his nose had been broken at some point. The boy had been in a fight with someone, and had clearly lost. "Did you do this?" he asked.

"Me? I've been sitting here the entire time. I believe he was fighting with someone but I didn't get a good look at them. Whoever it was though knocked him down and left him on the floor." He wondered what the boy's name was for a moment, then it came to him.

"He must be a Weasley" he sneered "they all have red hair and freckles like that, a family of blood traitors if ever there was one. What do you say boys, shall we show this one what we think of the Weasleys?" The other two both clenched and unclenched their fists.

Surprisingly Hermione didn't offer any objections, except one. "Not here though" she requested "I don't care to see a bunch of boys fighting in this carriage. If you are going to beat him up any more than he already is, take him outside."

"Alright" Malfoy agreed "come on boys, let's get Sleeping Weasley here out of her hair and get to work on him. His compantions, Crabbe and Goyle grabbed a leg each and started pulling him towards the corridor."

"Oh I believe this is his" Hermione offered then, taking Ron's wand out of her pocket. She negligently snapped it in half as she threw it onto the boy's chest, making it look like she had done so by accident. "Oops" she uttered.

Malfoy looked down at the broken wand but made no further comment. The three of them manhandled Ron out into the corridor and the door closed behind them. There were sounds of a body being pulled to some other part of the train, but even they faded away before long.

"A boy who thinks that Joke he called a spell is real magic doesn't deserve a wand anyway" she pointed out to Harry as she continued to sit on him.

"What are they going to do to him?"

"Oh, I imagine they'll knock the stuffing out of him. He'll probably be all covered in bruises by the time he gets to Hogwarts. His troubles won't end there either, I passed him his wand but it appears to have snapped in half. He won't be able to use it, so he'll have to use a replacement instead. That wand will not have chosen him though, he'll most likely struggle with it.

"I should help him"

"You'll do no such thing, you'll stay right there and be the comfortable little seat cushion that I know you are.Ron made the mistake of defying me by trying to take his wand back, and now he will pay the price. I am looking forward to seeing him again actually, whilst all the bruises are still fresh."

"But he is my friend."

"He was your friend Harry, now you only have me. You can call me a friend if you wish, but I know where you truly belong and what your real designation is. As long as you are a good seat and aceept your position and all my plans for you, I'll see to it that you won't suffer Ron's fate."

"I simply remain here and accept that you are sitting on me?".

"That is your role Harry, yes."

"Well do you think I might at least have my glasses back.

The journey continued, uninterruped and Hermione remained firmy seated upon Harry whilst he kept his finger up his nose. Time moved on and the countryside continued to pass by the window even though Harry couldn't see any of it. It was a couple of hours later that the compartment door opened and a red haired boy wearing Gryffindor robes an sporting a badge with the lettter 'P' printed on it walked through. Hermione thought he lokked something like and older version of Ron but with a particularly pompous expression on hisface. She wondered if that look might be a family trait.

"The train will be arriving in Hogsmeade station in five minutes" he read from a prepared piece of parchment, not even looking at Hermione or Harry as he read "if you have not done already, please change in to your Hogwarts robes, ready for departure. When you disembark, please leave your trunks and other possessions on the train, they will be brought up to the castle separately."

It was only after he had finished his prepared statement that he looked over at Hermione and Harry. "Why are you sitting on him, and why do you have your finger up your nose?" he asked.

"He is a comfortable seat" Herminoe replied, showing no desire to say any more than that.
"I chose to put my finger up my nose" Harry stated, not wanting to admit that Hermione had somehow compelled him to do it.
"You can remove your finger from your nose, Harry" she told him "it looks rediculous. When the boy leaves I'll let you get changed."

The older boy, Percy walked away off to give his isntructions to the people in the next compartment, and as soon as Herminoe had made her remark he gladly took his finger out of his nose. He had hated having it up there.

Hemrione slid in the chair opposite and moved to take the seat that Ron had occuplied earlier, her eyes fixed upon him. "Change in to your school robes, Harry" she instructed.

"Aren't you going to turn away while I get dresed. he asked, already starting to remove his travelling outfit.

"No I won't. Just keep getting dressed Harry."

The boy stripped down to his underwear, and then started to put on his school things. Hermione's eyes remained on him the entire time and this made him feel quite uncomfortable but he still continued to do as she had asked.

Once he was dressed, Hermione instructed him to sit down again, then she slid back into his lap. The train started to slow down and eventually stopped but she did not move from her seat until most of the students had already left the train. She then got off him and told Harry to follow her as she made her way out of their compartment and down on to the platform "Stay with me, Harry" she told him then.

"Firs' Years, Firs' years this way" a voice called out, and a giant of a man emerged from the crowd. "That's Hagrid, I've met him before" Harry told Hermione.

"Oh right" Hermione nodded, this was apparently one of Harry's former acquaintances and Hermione didn't want him to get chummy with anyone else at the school. For this reason she didn't even look at Hagrid, telling Harry to ignore the man and to stay with her. She did take him down towards the lake shore where Hagrid was leading the frist year students and a number of small boat waited for them, and after Hagrid entered one of the boats Harry desperately wanted to join him but found himself unable to do so. Instead Hermione led him told him to take a seat in an empty boat instead, and sat on him once more.

"No more than two to a boat" Hagrid said then, but that was fine with Hermione. She and Harry would have their boat to themselves.

The boats moved off from the shore and through some magical means they made their own way over to the opposite bank. There were no oars, no clear means of propulsion but the boats continued to travel of their own accord.

When they caught sight of the castle, there were collective gasps from most of the students, including harry. The magnifance of the place was somewhat marred for him though by his continued presence under Hermione and her apparent control over him. She however looked delighted by the sight before her and by Harry's presence under her. For her this was going to prove to be the perfect magical education.

When they had crossed the lake, and everybody had disembarked Hagrid took a disappointed look at Harry.

"I thought you might have said 'hello' at least Harry" he complained.

"I was getting acquainted with Hermione here." Harry informed him.

"Well it is good to see you are making friends" he responded, his voice still a little disappointed.

Hagrid then led the first year students towards the large doors that were the entrance to the castle, and knocked. The door was opened by a strict seeming witch who led the first years in to the castle and to a small side chamber."

"Welcome to Hogwarts" she told them all, then explained about the four houses and that the sorting would commence shortly. She then told them to wait quietly until they were summoned before leaving them alone in the room. For ancient looking ghosts also appeared in the room for a moment and gave their own greetings before they too disappeared.

1113121211212.content:
Even though the thought of Ron being permanently enslaved by a group of Slytherin girls was one that amused her greatly, Hermione knew that the they would be taken to the Great Hall for the sorting at any moment. Unlike most people in the room, she had read Hogwarts: A History and she knew the procedure that would be followed.

Soon enough, Professsor McGonagall returned and instructed the students to line up; Hermione instructed Harry to remain directly behind her as they made their way out of the side chamber and through the double doors of the great hall, towards the front where a hat and a stool awaited them.

McGonagall gave her instructions, although Hermione knew what was coming. She gave Harry some more instructions of her own, she had been using Harry as her seat cushion since she had met him and she didn't think that the sorting should be any excuse to change anything. He was surely far more comfortable a seat than that old wooden chair. She also knew that she would be called before him as her name was earlier alphabetically.

"When the professor calls my name, you will sit on that chair and remain there so I can sit on you" she informed him "no matter what I or anyone else says, you will not leave that seat until we have both been sorted into one of the houses. Whichever house I join, that is also the house to which you belong, remember that."

"Yes, Hermione."

They both watched a number of students being sorted, and each of the four houses started to swell their numbers before finally.

"Granger, Hermione"

That was the cue, immediately as Hermione's name was called, Harry came forward and took his place on the seat and Hermione followed behind him."

Professor McGonagall was not pleased at all by Harry's actions. "Is your name Hermione Granger?" she challenged him.

"No, Harry Potter."

"I am Hermione Granger" Hermione informed the woman "Harry, in about ten seconds I will sit in that chair, regardless of whether or not you are occupying it and I will remain there until the sorting hat has made its decisions." She used the plural form of 'decision' since she fully intended to remain seated until after both she and Harry had been sorted.

The professor saw no objection to Hermione's statement, it was fair warning after all and Harry was apparently disrupting this girl's sorting. "You heard her, Potter" she confirmed the girl's ultimatum.

So after ten seconds, Harry had not moved and Hermione sat on him again, this time in front of the entire school. Her movement as she sat was so natural that it would appear to those watching that she wasn't even aware that Harry was already occupying the seat. She of course knew precisely where he was and she sat firmly upon him, using her full weight to press him into the seat beneath her.

As McGonagall placed the sorting hat on her head, Hermione asked "Does anyone have a camera handy, I think this moment should be recorded for posterity."

A girl sat at the Gryffindor table produced a camera and pointed it at the front of the room, taking a picture of the stool and its two occupants. Hemrione smiled her thanks and felt that it would be really nice to be sorted into Gryffindor so she could thank the helpful girl in person.

"So my chair is not comfortable enough, is it?" the hat spoke in Hermione's head "you feel the need to bring a cushion to the sorting"

"Harry is such a comfortable cushion" Hermione thought back.

"I see in your mind that you have been using him in that capacity for some time."

"Yes, and I am loving every minute of it."

"How does Harry feel about that?"

"He has no objections."

"He can't object though, can he? You have bound him to you with powerful magic, a magic which has ensnared his very will and smothered it."

"Yes"

"He is your puppet, you have been pulling his strings since you first sat on him on the train."

"Are you going to tell anyone?"

"I can not, I too am bound by magic. The magic which gave me intelligence and will also prevented me from speaking aloud anything I find in a student's mind other than their house. I may not reveal the secrets of the soul, but I can tell you that your actions today would have pleased Salazar Slytherin."

"Not Slytherin" Hermione begged "I suspect Weasley and those girls he was with will be Slytherins, I don't want to be sorted with them."

"Hmm" the hat mused "if not SLytherin then where else shall I put you?"

"I see more in your mind" the hat added "and what a mind you have, so bright, so quick and agile. You have already memorised all the spells in your books i see. You could be a good fit for Ravenclaw."

"Yes" Hermione agreed, although she still remembered that a Gryffindor girl had taken her picture. Did she belong there?

"And you have a strong sense of right and wrong, you believe in honour and doing what should be done. I see that trait most keenly, far more than any other. In fact you belong in...."

"Wait please" Hermione added then, sure the hat was going to make its decision. It had still not said a word out lould but had instead spoken only in Hermione's mind."

"I have reached my decision, you don't wish to hear it?"

"Yes, but don't announce it to the school yet. I am perfectly comfortable where I am for the moment."

"Ah. Okay, I suppose I can hold of for a time. Incidentally, I have decided that you shall be a Gryffindor but as you say, I won't announce it yet."

"Thank you. Do you suppose you could also sort Harry into Gryffindor?"

"If it is in his mind."

"I would be grateful, also can he be sorted directly after me? I know you are sorting alphabetically but as you have pointed out yourself, he is also occupying this seat, directly under me."

"That is a good idea, actually."

"The record for a sorting is a little over 15 minuites isn't it?" Hermione had read Hogwarts: History

"Yes"

"Do you suppose we might break that record? First with me, then with Harry?

"Won't people get bored?"

"I shouldn't think so, not when they are enjoying the entertainment" Hermione had noticed that more people had been taking pictures of her sitting on Harry.

"They might get hungry."

"Then they'll appreciate their dinners all the more."

"Very well then, I think we have a deal."

Hermione smiles and continued to sit on Harry whilst she waited for the sorting for which she already knew the answer. She continued to sit on Harry the entire time.

It was around 17 minutes later when the hat told her it would be wrong to hold the sorting off any longer and announced "Gryffindor"

The Gryfffindor table cheered but Hermione did not stand, she remained seated."

"You may join your new housemates now, Miss Granger" Professor McGonagall informed her.

"Not just yet, We agreed that I should sit on Harry until the hat has reaced its decisions - plural. The hat has not yet chosen Harry's house."

"The tradition is that students are sorted alphabetically, Miss Granger."

"I know but since Harry is already here."

McGonagall asked the hat it it was willing to sort Harry next and the hat bent forwards slightly in an unmistakable nod.

"Very well" McGonagall raised her voice "Since Potter is already occupying the seat, the hat has agreed to sort him next. Miss Granger will remain seated upon him until the hat has reached its decision."

Professor McGonagall then removed the hat from Hemrione's head and placed it on Harry's. Neither Hermione nor Harry moved from their combined seat.

1113122.content:
Harry was in a blurry would of mainly sound and sensation.

The sensation was that of the girl, Hermione Granger who had been sitting upon him since she arrived, and the voice was hers. He heard little else as the red-haired boy Ron was now asleep on the floor, having been beaten unconscious by the girl who was using him as her seat.

He could not see clearly either as Hermione was in possession of his glasses, and in a curious way this actually heightened his other sensations such as the feeling of this girl who was sitting on his lap.

As Ron slept Hermione told harry about her own life, and about her parents who were both dentists. Harry had grown up in the muggle world even though his parents had both attended Hogwarts so he knew what dentists did.

He in turn told her about his own life, growing up with the Dursleys.

"You don't have to woory about those Dursleys any more Harry, you have me and I will take care of you."

"And sit on me too"

"Of course"

They continued to talk for several minutes, getting to know more about each other until eventually Ron started to stir.

Slowly he rose to his feet, he was in pain from the injuries she had inflicted on him so his rise was far from graceful.

"Oh, you're awake" Hermione muttered, hardly caring about Ron as Harry was the focus of her attentions.

"You bitch!" he yelled at Hermione "what did you do to me?"

"I don't care for your tone, Ronald" she warned him "you want some more?"

"Go to Hell!"

"No, not the same" she decided "I saw your attempt of magic earlier and I was less than impressed. I think I'll teach you a few lessons in wand waving."

"You know many spells?" Harry asked her. He had no objection to what Hermione was proposing, Ron was not being civil.

"A few simple ones" she nodded "haven't you read your books yet, Harry?"

"I tried, but nothing seemed to sink in"

"Then watch closely" she advised as she raised Ron's own wand and pointed it at him. She felt there was some poetic justice in cursing this boy with his own wand.

She let forth a string of curses, not one or two but move than a dozen and each one hit its mark.

Ron's skin broke out in boils, then blisters, then he started shaking uncontrollably. black sludge poured out of his ears, she gave his eyes conjunctivitis, she even caused bats to fly out of his nose. By the time she had finished , Ron was moaning on the ground, still under the effect of a bunch of spells and the only movement he seemed to be making was that his body was jerking in occasional spasms.

He was conscious though, Hermione had made sure of that, one of her spells had prevented the red haired boy from passing out, for she wanted him to go right on experiencing everything she had done to him. If not for that spell then the pain he was now feeling would have knocked him unconscious in moments.

The last spell she cast was a confundus charm which fogged his mind so that she and Harry could talk together without Ron acknowledging anything of what they were saying.

"A few spells" Harry asked, aghast

"Mayble a little more than a few" Hermione smiled back

"You're not. I'll change you since you can't see." Hermione then used her wand to nlock Harry's trunk and summon his uniform and robes to her. About 10 minutes later, Hermione finally dragged Harry to his feet again. He wondered how he would be able to make his way off the train on his own but Hermione grabbed his wrist, her grip felt particularly firm.

"You know him, I see" she commented.

"Okay" Harry said, sadly. He would miss Hagrid of course, but Hermione had given him an order and Harry knew he had to obey everything she said if he wanted her to help him pass his finals.

Hermione led him to the shore of the lake and guide him as to where to place his feet as she helped him on board. Once he was on board, he guided him to sit down on the wooden bench, then she in turn resumed her seat - upon him.

Hermione sat on him just as firmly as she had been when they were travelling on the train. Harry once gain felt her familiar presence and her weight upon him.

It wasn't long before two more girls boarded their boat, one was a blonde who seemed evem less intelligent than Ron had been, the other was of Indian descent, they too were dressed in their Hogwarts robles and they took the seat opposite Harry and Hermione.

"Hello, I'm Parvati" the Indian girl introduced herself.
"I'm Lavendar" spoke the other.
"Hermione, and this is my Harry."

"Because he is mine and I like sitting on him."

"I love being sat upon by Hermione"

Just then Lavender gave Harry a curious look. "Would you like me to sit on you?"
Harry could not answer, Hermione had not given him permisson
"Please address any questions regarding Harry to me, I speak for him now." Hermione stated
Can I sit on Harry?" Lavender asked her
"Later perhaps, for now he is my seat and will stay that way. Remember that he is mine though."
"I take it the same applies for me as well?" Parvaiti queried.
"It does indeed."

Soon the discussion turned to the hogwarts houses. "I'd love to be in Gryffindor" Hemrione remarked then "it sounds like the most noble of all the houses."
"I would love to be a Gryffindor" Lavender sighed
"My sister has her eye on Ravenclaw, but I guess if Harry here is sorted into Gryffindor..." she pondered.
"I can guarantee that Harry will be sorted into whichever house I decide" Hermione announced. She had read a great deal about the sorting and she knew the hat based its decision on your own choice. She could determine which choice that would be."
"Then lets make a pact, let's all be Gryffindors" Parvati declared
"Done!" came two responses, with a slight nudge from Hermione, Harry also agreed.

"I'm going to get Harry cleaned up" Hermione said then "we'll see you in a few minutes."

With that she took Harry across the room to the other doorway; the one that led to the bathroom.
Once inside, she closed the door and locked it.

"Now Harry" she told him "it is time to get you washed and ready for bed. First though, I will relieve you of your clothes."

Harry nodded, remembering that she had changed him into his robes on the train, and realising that she would probably be dressing and undressing him from now on.

Hermione unfastened then removed his robe first, and then his tie and shirt. She then removed his belt and unfastened his trousers and started pulling them down. She then helped Harry to sit on the toilet whilst she took off his shoes, socks and his troursers. At this point Harry was dressed only in his boxer shorts. Hermione folded his clothes neatly and placed them in a pile on the floor.

"Now, Harry" she advised "since you are an the toilet, you may as well make use of it. I would suggest you lower your boxers though since we don't want you to have any littlIe accidents."

It was true, Harry really needed to pee, it had been some time since he had last used the toilet but he wasn't happy about Hermione being in the room with him. Still, he managed to drop his boxers so they hung around his ankles and remained seated on the tiolet.

"Must you?" he asked, embarrassment in his voice?

"Must I what? You need some encouragement to go pee, Harry?"

She came over to where he was sitting on the toilet, and joined him. When she sat upon him this time, her presence was even more noticeable. In his practically-undressed state, she was even closer to him than before, her own body made contact with his in several places; most significantly the underside of her thighs.

"I am not moving until I am sure you have relieved yourself" she informed him "so go ahead."

Harry was by now used to being under her, but the fact that she was now sitting on him on the toilet clearly showed how natural the act had become.

It took a couple of minutes, and Harry could feel Hermione upon him the entire time. Eventually though, he started to urinate into the bowl. When he was finally dune, and Hermione was satisfied that he had finished, she flushed and then stood up, lifting Harry with her. She even helped him to shift his boxers back into place.

She then took Harry over to the sink where she brushed his teeth and washed his face and body with soap, water and cloth.

"Much better" she approved as she was towelling him off "now let's go back and rejoin the girls."

She took up the pile of Harry's clothes and then unlocked the door so they could leave together.

11131222121221112.content:
Hermione and Harry returned to Hermione's bedside to found that Lavender and Parvati were sitting on her bed, chatting amongst themselves.

"Is my bed comfortable?" Hermione asked them.

"Yes, but I can think of somewhere else I'd like to sit" Lavender responded, giving Harry a meaningful glance.

"Me too" Parvati agreed "at least I think so, we haven't sat on him yet."

"Why don't we fix that right now?" Hermione suggested "if one of you will look inside Harry's trunk, you'll find a large bag of sweeets near the top. Harry you will lay on my bed, face upwards."

Lavender and Parvati slipped off the bed to give Harry room, and he dutifully laid down on top of the mattress, his head on the pillow. Immediately, Hermione came over and sat down upon his chest.

"It was Lavender who opened Harry's trunk and took out the sweets, "When did you get these?" she asked.

"Harry purchased them on the train, he and Ron were sharing them when I arrived but they hadn't eaten many at that point. I sat on Harry of course, so he wasn't going to eat any more, and despite my suggestion that Ron finish them in peace, he tried to attack me. I stopped him, easily I would add so he wasn't going to be stuffing his face either."

"So you took them?" Parvati nodded

"I didn't see any reason to leave them on the train, so I tidied them away whilst I was helping Harry into his robes."

"Are we going to share them with Harry now?"

"No, Harry didn't finish his dinner, he shouldn't have anything more to eat. I don't think Harry should eat sweets any more anyway, he clearly doesn't have the appetite for them."

"It'd be a shame to let them go to waste" Lavender sighed as she joined Hermione, sitting upon Harry's groin.

"My thoughts exactly girls, let's have a little late night snack of our own." Hermione agreed.

"Yes let's" Parvati giggled as she came over to Hermione's bed and sat down on Harry's legs. All three girls were now sitting on him.

Harry could now feel all three girls upon him. By now he had gotten used to Hermione sitting on his lap but when she sat on his chest, there was an increased pressure, she felt even heavier than usual and now hwo other girls had joined her. Between them they were pressing him firmly into the mattress beneath.

Above him, they talked among themselves and tucked into the sweets he had purchased on the train.

"So what exactly was the arrangement which bound him to you?" Lavendar asked.

"I told him that if he obeyed my every instruction, I might help him with his end-of-year tests." She put the same emphasis on the word 'might'. "He told me himself that on his own he never learns anything, so on his own he is hopeless."

"Will you help him when the time comes?" Parvati queried.

Harry did not see the shake of Hermione's head at that point. What she said out loud was "It doesn't matter either way, Harry has given himself to me willingly, and there is no obligation on my part to do anything in return. He is obliged to obey my every instruction. Whether I assist him or not, the fact remains that he now belongs to me. He is mine, forever."

"He can't just change his mind?" Lavender asked.

"No, he has bound himself to be and I would say his magic or mine has enforced that bond. Why else do you think he can come up our staircase and not the one to the boys' dorms? The fact that he could not get to the top of those stairs means he could not overcome his commitment to me, and of course his trunk is right here. He belongs to me now. Isn't that right Harry?"

"Yes, Hermione" he replied.

"Is it true you can do magic already?" Parvati asked her "I seem to recall you said to that Malfoy boy that you had done loads to him. Was that just bravado?"

"It's true. I hit him a few times, knocked him out then when he came round I used his own wand on him. Harry was there, he'll confirm it."

"It is true" Harry confirmed "I couldn't see much of what was going on but I heard it all. She beat him senseless, cast loads of spells on him."

"Could you teach us?" Parvati asked "clearly you are smart if you know so much already."

"Sure" Hermione smiled "starting tomorrow I'll teach you everything I know, then we can study some more spells and become powerful witches."

"How about tonight?"

"I'm comfortable right now, I don't want Harry to start jumping around under me."

"Won't he learn the spells as well?"

"He might hear the words, but his eye sight is so poor he won't have a clue about our wand movements. There is no way he can reproduce our magic."

"Okay, from tomorrow then" Lavender agreed, then she yawned.

"I think I should get to sleep" she remarked "goodnight". She got off Harry then moved over to her own bed, drawing her curtains around her.

"Me too" Parvati added "see you in the mormning.

When Parvati left, Hermione was alone, still sitting on Harry and considering where he should spend the night.

After a few moments, Hermione had made up her mind and got off of Harry and the bed, pulling Harry to his feet. She pulled back the covers and guided Harry back to the bed, but this time facing downward.

"I do not want you drooling on my in your sleep, Harry." Hermione then pulled out her wand and pointd it at Harry. "Petrificus Totalus! Silencio! There, now you won't move around in your sleep or snore", said Hermione happily as she got out her nightie from her trunk and then went to the bathroom to change and get ready for bed. She came back to her bed and put Harry's glasses in her bedside drawer and locked it.

"Good night, Harry" said Hermione as she completely laid on top of him and pulled the covers over them, knowing full well he could not answer her back.

Although they did not know it, they both shared the same dream, but from their own perspectives. In the dream, Hermione, Parvati, and Lavender were practicing spells in their very dorm room. They were all drassed in their own casual clothes so it must have been at night or on a weekend. They were all sitting on Harry on Hermione's bed as the girls were all laughing and having a good time. But what was very odd was Harry's clothes. He wasn't wearing his old Dursley hand-me-downs. Those old hand-me-downs could actually be seen burning away in the fireplace. He was appearing to wear an old pillowcase as clothes and they looked remarkable similar to the pillowcase on Hermione's bed and that Harry was directly resting on.

Dream Hermione was even telling Harry that from now on, when he wasn't in his Hogwarts clothes, he was going to be wearing his current attire or nothing at all. And if she was lucky, then she might even be able to have Harry wear the pillowcase as a substitute for his Hogwarts uniform as well. When morning came, only Hermione remembered the dream and she was wondering why on Earth Harry was wearing what appeared to be her pillowcase. As Hermione was waking up and thinking about her dream, she heard Lavender and Parvati stir in their beds as they were waking up. She wanted to ask them about the dream without Harry overhearing and so she got out of her bed and let Harry sleep for now as she greeted Lavender and Parvati.

"Good morning, Lavender, Parvati" said Hermione.

"Good morning, Hermione." said both Lavender and Parvati. "Did you have a good night's sleep?" asked Laender.

"I did. It was so wonderful to be able to sleep on Harry all night. And since I paralyzed him and made him silent, no snoring and no tossing around in bed from my Harry. However, I had an odd dream last night."

"Odd? In what way?" asked Parvati.

Hermione then told her new friends all the details she remembered from her dream. As she was finishing, she asked them what was the significance in Harry wearing her piillowcase.

Lavender and Parvati giggled as Lavender said "In the dream, you're making Harry dress like a house elf. House elves are beings that are mostly enslaved by witches and wizards. The only way to free a house elf is to give them a piece of clothing. As such, enslaved elves normally wear pillowcases. Harry is not a house elf of course, so those clothes rules do not apply even though he is essentially enslaved by you. However, in your dream, you are making Harry dress like one anyway."

"Very interresting. Harry is my property and if our culture says slaves are not worthy to wear clothes, then that would make sense if I were to enforce that. My dreamself also mentioned perhaps having it replace his Hogwarts uniform as well."

Parvati and Lavender just burst out laughing at that. "Well you would make a good argument to the staff. Generally, only house elves are enslaved but Harry's a unique circumstance." said Parvati. "Going by those rules, you could make the argument that Harry is not worthy to wear even his Hogwarts uniform. But if that's indeed the future, how were you able to see it?"

"Maybe it had to do with the bond that Harry and I now share. Like you said, it's unique for a wizard to be enslaved by a witch like this. So maybe we can see certain things involving the two of us. Who knows? It hasn't been a full 24 hours yet" said Hermione.

"So should we burn his non-Hogwarts clothes tonight like in the dream?" asked Lavender.

"Hmmm, maybe. We'll see how the day goes. At the very least, I'd like to do it within a week. It would make dressing Harry every day much quicker after all."

"I'm hungry. How about we get ourselves and Harry ready for the day and go to breakfast?" asked Parvati as Lavender and Hermione nodded in agreement.

Hermione went over to her bed at that point, and the first thing she did was to cancel the body bind and silencing charms she had placed upon him the previous night. She then turned and seated herself upon his back. "Wake up, Harry" she told him.

If all went well he would not be wearing any regular clothes after today. She then gave him fresh socks and a clean shirt before putting on his trouses, tie and robes. Instructing him to stand or sit on the toilet seat as necessary. Before she assisted him into his trousers, she felt inside the pocket and removed his Gringotts key. She would be keeping that from now on.

At this point she dressed herself then unlocked the door and led Harry out of the bathroom. "Thank you for the use of your bath products" she smiled at Lavender.

Hermione then led Harry over to a chair beside her bed and sat on him whilst Lavender, and then Parvati used the bathroom.

111312221212211122112.content:
The three girls walked down together to the Great Hal, Hermione and Parvati guiding holding on to Harry and guiding his steps.
"Would it be al right if I sat on Harry when we get there?" Parvati asked Hermione "I've not sat on him alone yet, and it'd be fun to have him under me whilst I am tucking into my breakfast."
"Sure" Hemrione smiled "he should spend time under all three of us, alone as well as together. This time he is all yours."
"Harry" she added "you will allow Parvati to sit on you as firmly as she wants, for as long as she wants whenever I give her permission. The same is true for Lavender."
"Yes, Hermione" Harry nodded.
"Unless I tell you otherwise, whenever Parvati and/or Lavender sits on you, assume I have given my permission."
"Okay."

When they reached the Great Hall, Parvati guided Harry to an empty space at the Gryffindor table and instructed him to sit, which he did.
She then moved to stand in front of Harry for a moment before she seated herself upon him.

Harry noted immediately that being sat upon by Parvati was not quite the same as being sat upon by Hermione. Parvati's body was tanned, but that was not what Harry detected. She had come from a warmer climate though, and her body seemed to radiate a certain warmth though which reflected through to him, there was also a different texture to her skin. He was sure he could tell instantly whether Hermione or Parvati were sitting on him, he could not say the same for Lavender though for she had not sat on him alone yet.

What he could tell was that Hermione and Lavender had sat on either side of him, so closely that they were squashing him between their bodies.

Parvati had taken Hermione's instruction that she could sit on him as firmly as she liked quite literally. She allowed her backside to press down hard upon the boy who had become her seat, forcing him to experience the pressure of her full body weight upon him.

The girls then started to help themselves to whatever they could fit on their plates. Harry could hear sounds of...
"Would you like a couple of rashers of bacon, Lavender?"
"Could you pass me the sausages please?"
"I wouldn't mind a few hash browns."
"One egg or two?"
"I wonder if Harry will appreciate those beans as much as you do Parvati?", a comment which caused Parvati to giggle.
"Would you like some marmalade on your toast?"

Clearly they were enjoying a full cooked breakfast.

At one point, Parvati passed a plate to Harry, who was still waiting hungrily beneath her. The plate contained three slices of buttered toast and nothing more.
"Here is your breakfast, we know you haven't got much of an appetite" she informed him "when you have finished those, I'll give you some water to drink."
Having so recently arrived at the school, Harry didn't know all that much about butterbeer or pumpkin juice,

Hermione noticed, as she ate that there didn't appear to be any sign of Ron at the Slytherin table, "I wonder what happened to Weasley" she mused.
"I'll go and nose around a bit" Lavender responded "Slytherin table, yes?"
"Yes."
Harry felt the pressure on his body ease on one side as Lavender left the table, it returned a couple of minutes later.
"Apparently he is in the hospital wing" she informed them "I heard a group of third year Slytherin girls gloating about it."
"Clearly they have been having some fun" Hermione smiled "as are we."
"Indeed we are" Parvati agreed "Harry is such a squishy seat, I like feeling him squish."
"As do I" Hermione nodded "that privilege is yours for now."
Parvati applied even more pressure upon Harry at that point.
"Do you think that if I sat on him firmly enough, and for long enough that I might squish him completely flat?" she asked then.
"I'm not sure Hermione would want a flat Harry" Lavender remarked.
"I'd like to know I can restore him afterwards" Hermione commented "he is far more comfortable a seat when you can feel him under there."
"But do you think it is possible?"
"I don't know. I wouldn't have thought so but this is a school of magic, I don't think anything is beyond the realm of possibility. Don't try anything like that until I have researched it though."
"Okay" Parvati admitted, but she did not ease up in any way upon the boy she was still sitting upon.

Once they had all eaten their fill, and Harry had finished his toast and water, the discussion turned to their first classes?

"What is our first lesson today?" Lavender asked?
"Double Potions with Professor Snape" Hermione replied as she consulted her timetable.

"Parvati" Hermione said then "will you please keep sitting on Harry for now. I want to pay a visit to the Hospital Wing."
"I'll be happy to" Parvati nodded "are you unwell?"
"I'm fine, I just want to check on Ron."
"Oh, okay."

Hermione got up and left at that point, and left the hall. She wandered up a few flights of stairs to the Hospital Wing. The nurse didn't appear to be around, but she saw Ron in a nearby bed. He looked in a bad way, his face covered in welts, blisters and bruises, he looked to be in more than a little pain, and his head looked like it had been compressed, as though it had been partly deflated.

"What happened to you?" She asked, siding over to Ron's bed and sitting in a nearby char. She would not sit on the boy, that position was of course reserved for Harry.

"Those Slyherin girls" Ron remarked "a group of senior girls pounced on me this morning and used me to practice their spells upon. I think I've been hit by every curse ever invented. If that's not bad enough, some third years grabbed me as soon as I entered the common room. They threw me to the floor and sat on me, they didn't get up. They just chatted amongst themselves and occasionally laughed at me.

"What do you expect, you know what the Slytherins are like."
"Now I am stuck with them, thanks to you."
"Me?" Hermione's voice had taken on a threatening edge.
"That spell of yours, it fogged my mind. I couldn't think clearly and thanks to you some other girls got hold of me and forced me to join their house."
"You tried to come between me and Harry" she told him "now you are suffering the consequences."
"Bitch!"
Hermione slapped him sharply across the face as soon as that word left his lips. "Don't ever speak to me like that again, you chose Slytherin you silly boy. You brought this on yourself. I knew you weren't quite bright and this proves it."
"Get out!"
"Make me"

Just than an owl flew in through an open window, dropped an letter on Ron's bed then flew off again.
"Errol" Ron called after the bird, clearly recognising the bird and feeling a little hurt that it hadn't stayed and greeted him.
Hermione snatched the letter from the bed and read it aloud.

------
Ron

It has come to our attention that you have joined Slytheirn house.

As you are aware, our family has for the longest time been proud of our association with Gryffindor, and now this happens. We would not have minded Hufflepuff which is house of decent, hard working people, and whilst we knew you hardly qualified, we would of been okay with Ravenclaw but now you have chosen to shack up with the snakes.

Your father and I have never been so disgusted. As a result of this most grave of insults, we have decided to expel you from our family. Your picture has been dismissed from the family portraits, your likeness has been burned from the family tree. You are not worthy of the name Weasley and must demand that you stop using it. You are no longer welcome in our house, you will need for find alternative accommodation. We will ship all your belongings to the school, you can collect them from Professor Dumbledore.

Incidentally Gunny has been asking about Harry Potter, if you see him then can you please ask him to write back to her. She eagerly awaits his reply.

This is the last letter that Errol will ever send you, and he knows it. Don't bother asking him to write back to us, he won't accept any of your mail. I am sure he is already on his way home.

Our home, but no longer yours.

With disregards
Your mother (formerly)
----

"Tut tut tut, Ron" Hermione uttered as she finished reading "it seems you have lost everything, except perhaps your Slytherin identity. You still have a place in their house, even though they clearly don't want you either."

"You're enjoying this aren't you?"

"Yes, Ron. Very much."

"Bitch!"

She slapped him again.
"Forget that word, Ron unless you want me to keep on hitting you."

"Can't I even have the letter back?"

"This letter?" she showed it to him so he could read it for himself, but still kept it out of his reach.
"No" she added, once she was sure he had read it all. She scrunched it into a ball and laid it on the palm of her hand. Waving her wand over it, the letter bust into flames but the flames did not harm her at all. Once the letter had burned down to ash, the flames died leaving her hand completely unmarked. She then blew the ashes over Ron's bed."

"I am getting used to enchanted fires" she remarked.

Ron groaned.

"What is your former sister's fascination with Harry?" Hermione asked.

"She can't get enough of him, ever since Fred and George told her who she was..."

"Fred and George."

"My twin brothers, they both have red hair like all my family."

"No longer brothers, no longer family" Hermione amended "I think I saw them at the Gryffidnor table during the feast. Go on."

"They told Ginny who you were, and she immediately asked her mother if she could go on the train so she could meet Harry."

"What were her intentions?

"I'm not sure exactly. If Harry wrote to her, perhaps she could tell him. Now will you please leave, I have nothing more to say to you."

"Very well Ronald" Hermione nodded, getting up but before I go I will give you back something that you have clearly lost."

"Your sense of befuddlement" she added as she pointed her wand at him and cast the confundus charm again. She then punched him in the gut before she left.

Before returning to the Great Hall, Hermione took a side trip to the Owlery.

Ron had told her that his sister had an interest in Harry and Hermione wanted to see what her intentions were. Did she have a crush on him, or was it something else. Were Ginny's plans for Harry anything like her own?

As she had not yet had chance to introduce herself to Harry's owl, she didn't expect for a moment that she would deliver the letter for her, but she rather hoped that she would. Apparently the Weasleys had seen Harry's owl, so Ginny might recognise it if she saw it again. If she saw Harry's owl delivering the message then she might be more willing to write back.

When she reached the owlery, she started to compose a note on a spare piece of parchment.

---------
Ginny

You do not know me yet but my name is Hermione Granger

Your brother (or from what I here ex-brother Ron tells me that you asking about Harry Potter

Harry and I met on the train and we had an immediate connection. We have already become very close and as such I have taken it upon myself to provide for his every need.

I am also told that when you found out who he was, you wanted to board the train and join him. I wonder why this is. As his own request, he has asked me to take care of all his interests, do you have designs on the boy who lived?

If you do not take me seriously then I will make sure you never get anywhere near him, so please reply to this message.

Hermione
-----

At this point, Harry's own owl flow down and landed on her shoulder.

"Hello, Hedwig" she said then "you remember me from the train don't you, You saw me sitting on Harry."

Hedwig gave a soft hoot.

"You remember that shortly after that he gave himself to me completely, and unconditionally. Harry is mine now."

Another hoot.

"Are you mine too, Hedwig?" she asked "have you seen what Harry has become and changed your allegiance? If you are my owl now then please extend your right leg so I can attach this letter.

Hedwig extended her leg, she had become Hermione's owl. Harry no longer owned her.

Hermione quickly wrote on the bottom of the note. "I am sure you recognise the owl who delivered this. Hedwig will be handling my letters from now on."

Hermione then attached the letter to the owl's leg and Hedwig flew off with it.

She would have to wait a while for GInny's repsonse she was sure, even if Ginny did respond. She wasn' t sure where GInny lived but if it was any distance then it would take Hedwig a while to reach her.
