111312221212211122112111.content:
Parvait was still seated upon Harry. She had remained seated whilst she waited for Hermione to return, and she was perfectly happy to continue for Harry was a comfortable seat.

Eventually though Hermione did return and told her about what she had discovered about Ron in the hospital wing, and about her trip to the owlery. Parvati and Lavender both laughed when they heard that his family had disowned him. "Serves him right, he shouldn't have acted that way towards you."
"No he shouldn't and it seems those Slytherin girls are having some real fun with him" Hermione agreed.

She continued and Parvati smiled when she heard about Hedwig.
"So Harry's owl is yours now?"
"Yes, she has turned her back on Harry and accepted me instead, I've always wondered what it would be like to own an owl and now I do."

"Ought we not to be getting to classes" Lavender asked "I've heard Snape can be mean, it would be best not to be late for Potions.

"I guess that means I'll have to get up" Parvati signed "I was so enjoying sitting on Harry."

"I'm sure it won't be too long before he as back under you" Hermione promised "but Lavender is right, we should go."

They all got to their feet, lifted Harry from the bench where he had been pressed by Parvati for so long, and carried him from the Great Hall

They made their way down the staircase which led to the dungeons and entered the Potions classroom. The class had not yet started and there were still spaces, including room for 4 people to sit together in a row near the front.

"Which one of us should sit on Harry?" Parvati asked.

"Let's feel things out first" Hermione suggested "we don't know how Snape will feel about Harry being sat upon by us during his class."

So it was that Harry was allowed to sit for now between Hemione and Parvati. Lavender sat on the other side of Hermione.

They each got out their scales, cauldrons and other items they would need for this lesson. Nobody bothered to take anything out for Harry though.

A few moments later, Snape entered the room. He have a short speech about 'no foolish wand waving' and talked about 'bottling fame, brewing glory and stoppering death' His eyes swept the room and saw that Harry was not looking his way, or was trying but failing due to his poor eyesight. What was more significant was that there was nothing on the desk in front of him.

"Clearly though, someone here feels my classes aren't worth the effort" he snorted "Mr Potter, our new celebrity." He drew out the word 'celebrity' making it sound as ominous as possible.

"Tell me, Potter. What would I get if I added powdered root of aspadel to an infusion of wormwood?"

"I don't know sir"

"You don't know? Where might you look if I asked you to find me a bezoar?"

"I don't lmw, sir."

"What is the difference between Monkshood and Wolfsbane?"

"I don't know sir"

"Pity, clearly fame isn't everything, is it Potter? 10 points from Gryffindor"

Hemrione wasn't pleased about the lack of points, but what she had seen of Snape had clearly told her that he was not at all fond of Harry, perhaps she could use that to her advantage. Perhaps she had found the professor who could me most receptive to making her dream a reality. She therefore wanted to get on this professor's good side, Lavender said he could be nasy if provoked so she didn't want to provoke him. She knew the answers to all three of the questions he had asked Harry of course, but she prudently chose not to draw attention to the fact.

Harry still had not made eye contact with Snape, the professor had noticed. "Why aren't you looking at me when I talk to you, Potter?" he asked "are you blind."

Hermione at this point decided the time had come to start leading Snape's mind in a certain direction so finally she spoke up. "He does wear glasses normally, sir."

Snape sneered at Harry. "Really, where are your glasses, Potter?"

At this direct question, Hermione's earlier instruction forced him to speak as he had been told. "I chose not to wear them any more" he answered.

"You chose not to wear them, arrogant as well as blind. Do you take anything seriously? Why did you even bother coming to Hogwarts?"

"Neither do I, Get out of my sight. I don't want to see you for the rest of this lesson."

Hermione saw her chance. "May I sit on him, Professor?" she asked.

"You may indeed, Miss Granger" he nodded "keep him out of my sight."

"Yes, sir" Hermione then moved a cross and seated herself firmly upon Harry.

Snape was well aware of course that Hermione had sat upon Harry during the feat, and the way she had suggested doing so again told him that she intended to make a habit of it. He was intrigued. "Take back those ten points for your excellent suggestion" he informed her "and every class of mine that you spend sitting on Potter will earn you five additional points."

Hermione beamed, all she had to do was sit on Harry during Snape's classes and she would amass a ton of points for Gryffindor. She was earning the professor's approval. Perhaps that might make him more receptive to the suggestion she would make a little later. Everything was working according to plan.

Harry could feel Hemrione sitting on him again, and just as fully as she had before. This time though, he knew he would remain under her for at least the next couple of hours.

"There is something else I would like to ask you sir, but it can wait until we have a quiet time or the end of the lesson" Hermione offered then.

"I'll keep that in mind" Snape countered "for now concentrate on your potion, we will talk on this other matter later."

Hermione nodded and remained seated upon Harry as she started to work on her potion. She didn't have to go and hunt for her ingredients, unlike the other students either. Everything she needed was provided for her. Snape clearly did not want her to move from her 'seat'.

It was around an hour later when Snape came over to talk with her. He glanced at her cauldron and nodded. Clearly he could see no fault with her work.

"What was this other matter you wanted to discuss?" he asked.
"Sir, I was thiking about Harry, I believe you when you said that a boy that arrogant does not deserve to be at the school."
"I do not seek your approval, Miss Granger."
"No sir, well I would like to offer an alternative to simply expelling him, you might find it a little more - entertaining."
"I'm listening."
"Well sir, I think we can both agree that if Harry doesn't care for his education then he has no right to wear that uniform."
"Indeed, yet you you speak of an alternative to expelling him."
"No, I don't think expelling him would serve any purpose. I would lose this seat of mine and he would just take that arrogance elsewhere."
"What do you suggest.
"I would suggest instead a punishment which would humiliate him and put him firmly in his place."
"Go on."
"I have been learning about house elves sir, enslaved creatures who are forced to wear nothing more than a pillow case for they are not allowed proper clothing."
"Yes, there are a number of them who work in the school kitchens."
"Well sir, perhaps we could compel Harry here to dress in the same way, at least until he agrees to put his glasses on again."
Snape actually laughed at that. "Perfect!" he cried "take another ten points Miss Granger. I'll propose it to the rest of the staff, but the one I will really need to convince is his Head of House, Professor McGonagall. She is the one who has the final say with regard to Gryffindors.
"Of course, thank you sir."

Hermione was delighted of course. By proposing her idea as a form of punishment for refusing to wear his glasses, she might even be able to get McGonagall to agree, and then she and the other first year girls could put Harry in that pillowcase and burn all his clothes. He wouldn't need them again. It did not matter that she herself had robbed him of his glasses, nobody would think that since Harry himself would continue to ascertain that his not wearing them was his own idea.

The potions class continued, and by the end of it Hermione, Lavender and Parvati had all produced perfect potions. Snape gave Gryffindor five more points a piece before he dismissed the class.
111312221212211122112111.title: Hermione, Harry and the others go to Potions

choices: They study in their dorm room.
1113122212122111221121112.content:
As the girls were walking away from Potions class (with Hermione and Parvati holding onto Harry's arms to guide him) towards the Great Hall, they were having a great time reliving what happened.

"I can hardly believe that you got Professor Snape as an ally on your first class, Hermione", said Lavender. "That must be a record for Gryffindor."

"Yeah, well I could tell he hates Harry, so it was easy to use that as an advantage. And he'll give us more points for sitting on Harry!" said Hermione.

"And it's a good thing too. Without his eyesight, Harry would be a danger to everyone if he were allowed to brew Potions. Who knows what mistakes he would make that would be disastrous to us all?" said Lavender.

"Good point, Lavender. Potions have to be done very carefully and Harry in his current state is no shape to ever brew a Potion." said Hermione.

Soon enough, the group got to the Great Hall and Parvati resumed her place as the one to sit on Harry as Lavender and Hermione sat on her sides to squish him. The girls were happily eating a filling lunch as the Great Hall slowly filled up with students and teachers. About halfwal through their lunch, the girls noticed that the staff were in whispers as they were discussing something.

"It must be the suggestion you gave to Snape" said Parvati. "I can tell they're looking at us every now and then."

"I agree. But it's like what Professor Snape said; Professor McGonagall has the final say when it comes to Gryffindor students. If we get her on our side, then our plan to change Harry's uniform will be complete." said Hermione.

"Hey, we should study up on more advanced Transfiguration before we have our first class with her. We'll really impress her with our own prowess at Transfiguration as well as showing we can keep the rebellious Harry in line" suggested Lavender.

"Good idea, Lavender!" said Hermione. After giving Harry a single sandwich to eat and water to drink, they all left the Great Hall to study some advanced (for a new first year, anyway) Transfiguration to impress their Head of House.


Note: I decided to take down my previous chapter of this and redo it.
1113122212122111221121112.title: They return to the Great Hall for lunch.

choices: They take Harry back up to their dorm room
11131222121221112211211122.content:
The girls (with Harry) left the Great Hall, heading for the library so they could study some more advanced transfiguration spells. It was Hermione's suggestion that they should go to the library rather than back to their dorms. "We all have the first year course book, but there are bound to be more choices in the library."[/b] Also, the book they held was a beginner's guide and they wanted to show to Professor McGonagall that they were capable of more than entry level spells.

"Will pulled off some fantastic feats of Transfiguration already" Parvati remarked "we have turned Harry Potter into a seat cushion."
"Not to mention you have turned Ronald Weasley into a snake" Lavender addressed Hermione.
"That wasn't exactly the plan" Hermione admitted "but rather a happy yet unanticipated conclusion. His entire family had been Gryffindors. I don't think either of us wanted to share the common room a boy who was being protective towards our Harry." She was perfectly content to know that Ron was out of heir way.

As they reached the library, Hermione spoke with Lavender. "Would you like to sit on Harry while we study? I think you are more than due."
"I'd love to, thank you Hermione" she smiled back.

So it was, that whilst Hermione and Parvati searched the Transfiguration shelves, Lavender led him to an empty table in the corner which had three seats surrounding it. She instructed Harry to sit in the nearest seat, and as soon as he had done so, she joined him there by sitting on top of him.

Harry could clearly tell that the girl who was now sitting on him was neither Hermione nor Parvati, but curiously, because Hermione had taken his glasses from him on the train, Harry had no clue as to what Lavender or Parvati looked like. He was aware that Parvati was an Indian girl, but Lavender was a complete mystery to him. Like the other two girls, Lavender sat firmly, using her full weight to press him into the seat. There was also a delicate yet distinctly feminine fragrance which reminded Harry of the bath products that Hermione had used with him earlier. He was under no doubt right now that ther person sitting on him was a girl.

A few minutes later, Hermione and Parvati returned and took the other two seats at the table. "We've looked at some Transfiguration books and this one is probably the best choice, giving each of them a copy.

"Advanced Transfiguration by Emeric Switch" Lavender read "well at least we are familiar with the author."

"It seemed the more advanced stuff is really interesting" Parvati mused "especially that book I saw about Animagi"

"That is really advanced magic" Hermione nodded "and anyone who succeeds in becoming an animagi needs to register with the ministry. We could look into it later perhaps. McGonagall would most likely wrap us all up in red tape for days if we managed to pull off anything like that."

"Yes, for now we just want to demonstrate that we can transfigure normal stuff" Lavender agreed.

Parvati leafed through her copy of the book. "This looks quite tricky" she sighed.

"I am sure between us we can get through it" Hermione assured her "which spell should we try?"

"How about this one?" Lavender asked "turning a sock into a glove, we all have socks after all."

Hemrione nodded. "Good point, let's give it a go?" She took off one of her socks, as did Parvati. Hermione helped Lavender to remove her sock so that she could remain seated upon Harry.

Their first attempts were not entirely successful, but it was Hermione who managed to perform the spell correctly first, and then showed the others how it was done. They followed this spell up with two more from the book, and within half an hour they had all mastered all three spells.

"That should really impress McGonagall" Hermione smiled as she collected their books and returned them to the shelves.
11131222121221112211211122.title: They study in the library.

choices: The group goes to their dorm room.
The group runs into the Slytherin girls on their way.
111312221212211122112111221.content:
After leaving the library, the girls guided Harry to the Transfiguration class. They were so excited about what they were set to accomplish, that they wanted to be the first ones in class. When they got to the classroom, it was empty and they found a nice row in front that could seat four people.

“Now Harry, you are going to sit between myself and Lavender at the start of class. If Professor McGonagall does a notes section of class before actually practicing Transfiguration, you are not to take notes; you wouldn’t be able to see them anyway” said Hermione.

“Okay, Hermione”, replied Harry as Hermione was already taking him to his seat. After Harry was seated between Hermione and Lavender, with Parvati on Hermione’s other side, Hermione continued giving Harry instructions.

“When we get to the practical part of class, you will not attempt transfiguration until Professor McGonagall directly asks you to do so. However, if you fail, then you need to turn to me (here Hermione turned Harry’s head gently to indicate where to turn), and say ‘Hermione, can you please do this for me?’ and give me your wand. After that, I’ll take your wand and do it for you.”

Lavender and Parvati giggled when Harry replied that he would; that would put him in an even worse light with Professor McGonagall as it would give her the impression that he was giving up on attempting his task.

At that point, other students (the other male Gryffindors and the Hufflepuffs) started entering the classroom. The Gryffindors were glaring angrily at Harry as they were severely disappointed in him, but made no attempt to talk to him or the girls with him. After a while, Professor McGonagall entered the classroom and started the class. After roll call, she mentioned that she would not tolerate students who didn’t take the class seriously or those who goofed off in class and she sent a small glare at Harry and turned her desk into a pig and then back to a desk.

With that, she began giving them a lot of notes to copy down and she was internally furious that Harry, who was not wearing his glasses as well, was the only one not taking notes. After that, she gave everyone matches and told them to turn it into a needle. Over the next ten minutes, students were attempting to turn their needles into matches. Most students could only turn it silver or pointy and Neville Longbottom was having no luck at all but was trying his best nonetheless. Hermione, Parvati, and Lavender were the only ones to completely turn their matches into needles and got fifteen points each.

“Congratulations, girls. It’s not often that I see such splendid work in one’s first class with me.”

“Thanks, Professor McGonagall” replied Hermione. “We’ve been practicing even higher transfiguration in our free time. Would you like to see?”

“Sure” said a smiling Professor McGonagall. She raised her eyebrows a bit when Hermione and Lavender bent down and pulled off Harry’s shoes, then his socks, and put his shoes back on. To her great surprise, Lavender and Parvati both turned one of Harry’s socks into a glove. Hermione then reached over into Harry and pulled out his tie; she then turned the tie into a very long rope. It was by no coincidence that the girls had chosen pieces of Harry’s clothes to transfigure for their demonstration.

“Fantastic! That’s very advanced transfiguration. Thirty more points each for Gryffindor.”

At that point, she turned her gaze at Harry and directly asked him to turn his match into a needle since he hadn't tried yet. Harry was only going off of the spell he kept hearing everyone say, but not knowing where his match was, just pointed straight on the desk and said the spell to no effect. What she heard next, after he had attempted the spell just one time, shocked her to her core and the rest of the students (save for the 3 female Gryffindor 1st years).

“Hermione, can you please do this for me?” asked Harry as he turned towards Hermione (remembering her subtle instruction from earlier) and held out his wand with his palm open. Hermione took Harry’s wand and then replied that she would and did it for him.

“What is the meaning of this, Mr. Potter?! You ask your fellow Gryffindor to do the task for you?” asked Professor McGonagall.

“I can’t do it, Professor, so I asked Hermione to do it.”

“I don’t want to hear anymore of this, Mr. Potter. You obviously do not take your education seriously and it is very clear to me that Professor Snape was right about you. Perhaps the punishment idea that he presented at lunch will straighten you out” said Professor McGonagall, to the confusion of everyone who was not in the know. “Class dismissed except for the 4 Gryffindors at this table.”

As the rest of the students left the classroom, whispering and speculating what Harry’s punishment would be, she glared angrily at Harry.

“As your Head of House, I declare that until you start wearing your glasses again and take your education seriously, you are not to wear your Hogwarts uniform. You are to wear the attire of a house elf, a pillowcase, and attend your classes as the seat cushion of Miss Granger, Miss Brown, or Miss Patil as you have been doing during meals and Professor Snape’s class. You are also forbidden to use magic at all until you start wearing glasses again. Is that understood?”

“Yes, Professor. I have no intentions of wearing my glasses again though.” as he replied in the way that he knew Hermione wantd him too.

“Get out of my sight, Mr. Potter. I’ll inform Professor Flitwick that you four are excused from his class today because Mr. Potter is not dressed properly” said Professor McGonagall as she prepared to leave. “If you three girls ever need anything or want extra guidance to advance yourselves, please don’t hesitate to ask. You all have great potential and I want you to reach it.”

“Thank you very much, Professor McGonagall. We’ll keep that in mind” replied Hermione as Parvati and Lavender nodded their heads in agreement. Professor McGonagall nodded her head as well and left the classroom. Hermione and the others followed suit just a moment later.
111312221212211122112111221.title: They went to Transfiguration class

choices: They return to the great hall for dinner
They start practising their Charms whilst still sitting on Harry
1113122212122111221121112211.content:
Hermone and company left the Transfiguration classroom and headed back to Gryffindor tower. Once there, they continued up the stairs and entered the first year girls' dorm room, leading Harry with them.

Once they were in their dorm and Lavender had closed the door behind them, Hermione addressed Harry.

"Professor McGonagall has forbidden you using magic" she told him "you therefore have no more use for a wand. You will snap your wand into three equal lenghts and give one to each of us."

"Yes Hermione" Harry responded as he took out his wand. It did not matter that the wand was Harry's greatest link to the magical world, hils tool, his weapon. The great attachment even a first year student had to their wand counted for nothing. Hermione had given him an instruction, he had to obey her. He snapped has wand as instructed and gave pieces to each of the girls. Lavender and Parvati took them back to their own beds and stored them in their drawers along with their own possessions. Hermione shut her wand fragment in the same place where she stored Harry's glasses and locked them away.

Once the wand pieces were taken care of, Lavender had a suggestion.

"I think it is time we made this dream of ours a reality" she commented "McGonagall also said Harry will dress only in a pillow case from now on."

"Isn't it too early?" Parvati asked "that dream was set at night or during a weekend wasn't it?"

"We assumed it was because we were wearing casual clothes."

"We are wearing our robes though"

"We can soon get changed, as we are all excused from Charms, we don't have any more reason to wear our robes. What do you say, Hermione."

"I agree with Lavender" she smiled "it is time, and won't it make a great impact on everyone when Harry goes to dinner dressed only in this pillow case?" She pointed to the pillow on her bed.

Hermione unlocked Harry's trunk and opened it."

"Harry, you will now take all your clothes out of your trunk and pile them on my bed. Once they are on my bed you will not touch them again. All your clothes Harry, that includes robes, dress robes, underwear, shoes, casul clothes, winter clothes, coats and dragon hide gloves. All articles of clothing, Harry."

"Yes Hermione" he nodded as he started to pile his clothing on her bed."

"Incidentally, if anyone offers you any article of clothing in the future, you will give it to me." Whether or not she was aware that Harry would one day be given his father's invisibility cloak, the instruction she just gave would mean that Harry would surrender this cloak to her as soon as he received it.

Whist Harry was attending to his task, Hermione, Parvati and Lavender got changed out of their school robles and dressed instead in casual skirts and tops.

They returned to Hermione's bed, just as Harry was finishing his task.

"Are you done, Harry?" Hermione asked him "are those all your clothes except what you are currently wearing?"

"Yes, Hermione"

She closed and relocked his trunk at that point.

"Then all that remans is to relieve you of those as well. She proceeded to undress Harry at that stage, instructing him to sit or stand as needed. When she was done Harry stood completely naked in front of her. Hemrione threw his remaining clothes on to the bed then stripped the pillow case from her pillow. She magically enlarged it as Harry was somewhat bigger than a house elf then she fittied him in it.

"You will wear this pillow case at all times" she informed him "you will not remove it, and you will not allowe anyone except Parvati, Lavender or myself to do so either."

"Very well, Hermione."

"Now sit on that chair while Lavender and Parvati throw your clothes in the fire." she indicated the chair next to her bed.

Harry sat in the chair and Hermione immediately sat on top of him. Lavender and Parvati were laughing whist they carried piles of Harry's clothes from Hermione's bed to the nearby fire which was burning merrily. It only took them a few minutes to clear all the clothes from Hermione's bed.

"Harry's clothes are burning, what else did that dream tell us?" Lavender asked.

"Harry was laying on the bed, we were all sitting on him and we were casting spells." Parvati recalled

Hermione got off Harry at that point.

"Lay on the bed, Harry" she instructed him "lay on your back so we can all sit on you"

Haarry stood, went over to Hermione's bed, and laid down with his head resting on the uncovered pillow. Hermione sat on him again, this time she sat on his chest and Lavender sat on his legs.

Parvati looked over at Harry, laying on the bed with Hermione and Lavender already on top of him and nodded as though she had decided something. She walked over to the bed and stood near the pillow where his head rested. "Turn your head this way Harry, I don;t want to smother you" she told him."

"Do it" Hermione affirmed.

Harry turned his head towards Parvati, who then turned her back on him, She then pushed the back of her skirt back with her right hand as she sat, settling her backside directly upon his head. Her skirt dropped back into place and fromed a tent around his head, hiding him underneath."

"I'll have to try that later" Hermione giggled.

"What spells shall we cast?" Lavemder asked then.

Hermione already knew the answer to that question, she had provmised her fellow first years that she would teach them all the spells she had already learned.

"Here, try some of these" she told them "feel free to practice them on Harry."

She showed them the full body bind, how to stun people, the confundus charm, and many others including a selection of curses. The girls all aimed their wands at Harry when they cast their spells After a few attempts, Lavender and Parvati had successfully cast every spell that Hermione had showed them.
1113122212122111221121112211.title: The group goes to their dorm room.

choices: Hermione takes Harry to meet the house elves in the kitchens
They take Harry back up to their dorm room
11131222121221112211211122111.content:
Feeling Parvati sitting on his head was a new and even more intense experience than when she had sat on his lap. He saw her skirt going over his head, and then as she sat, the skirt cut him off completely from the outside world. He was in utter darkness, and so instead of seeing the blurry images which normally surrounded him when he wasn't wearing his classes, he now could not see anything. His eyes had been rendered totally inoperative.

He was fairly sure of what would confront him if he could see though, his head was turned towards her legs so the back of her legs and the underside of her knees would now be directly in front of him. He found himself wishing that he could indeed see that wish was so close and yet so elusive but he was sure that any such desires would not become reality.

His reality was the feeling of the girl sitting on him once more, she was no more heavy than when she sat on his lap and yet her nearness to his face and the skirt that her tend had formed meant that he was truly engulfed by her presence. Her fragrance was unmistakabe, her warmth, her weight, the feel of her upon him was maginified ten-fold by the fact that she now sat upon his head; a far more sensitive area than his lap had been.

The girls had not contented themselves with merely sitting either, Hemrione was instructing the others in the use of their wands and before long he felt a multitude of spells being cast upon him. Some of the curses they used were really unpleasant, the body bind held him in a firm grip that made him realise how Ron must have felt when that spell had been cast upon him. Curiously stunning wasn't that bad, only he was sure the girls lifted the stuns almost as soon as they cast them. He did not think they wanted him to stay unconscious for long.

Eventually though the barage of spells stopped, and many of the spells -especially those that might leave a mark on him were lifted.

Lavender suggested that it was time to go to dinner and the other girls agreed. They got off Harry and lifted him to his feet. The blurred image once more hit his eyes as Harry's vision - such as it was - returned when Parvati got off his head.

Once more they escored Harry down to the Great Hall, and as they entered the croweded room there were gasps and sounds of laughter from the students already present. The Slytherins in particular made no attempt to hide their mirth at the sight of Harry dressed in nothing more than a bed sheet. Many of the pureblood Slytherin students had elves at home so they knew the significance of the pillow case that Harry was wearing.

"Loving your new elf, Granger" Malfoy laughed out loud from his place at the Slytherin table "House elves really are the lowest of the low, I'd say Potter's found his natural calling."

Hermione didn't bother trying to correct the Slytherin boy, he was after all making a valid point.

She led him over to the Gryffidnor table, and once again she instructed him to take a seat. Once he was in place, Hermione sat upon him once more. She had allowed Lavender and Parvait to sit on him for a while, but Harry was after all her own seat cushion. Lavender and Parvati squished him from the sides as they sat on either side of Hermione.

The girls enjoed a full roast dinner, followed by dessert and custard. Hemrione at one point slipepd Harry a small plate of food and a glass of water.

After dinner...
11131222121221112211211122111.title: They return to the great hall for dinner

choices: Winky offers to give Harry a demonstration of her displeasure
Winky says nothing more, the girls leave with Harry
111312221212211122112111221111.content:
Dinner was over and Lavender was the first to raise the question of what to do next. "What now, shall we take Harry back to the common room?"

"Not yet" Hermione responded "I say we take Harry down to see the kitchens first."

"He won't seem much" Parvati added "not when he doesn't have his glasses any more."

"True, but those who work in the kitchens will no doubt see him."

"Who works there?"

"House elves"

"Actual house elves? I don't imagine they'll be al lthat impressed with Harry, considering what he is wearing."

"Perhaps not, but that is not our problem."

"Do we have a problem?"

"Maybe. The elves have a reputation for wanting to help humans, particularly their masters and for the elves that work here, that could mean coming to the aid of the students. We should explain to them that Harry is not their master, he is not their concern."

"Then we shoudl go there right now" Parvati nodded.

The girls carried Harry back out of the double doors of the Great Hall, and down a staircase towards a portrati showing a bowl of fruit. Hermione tickled one of the fruits displayed and the painting moved aside, revealing a doorway. They passed through it and emerged in a large kitchen, in which small creatures with large ears and who like harry were dressed only in sheets were busy washing all the empty pots and dishes from dinner.

One of the elves, a female approached the new arrivals and asked in a squeaky voice "Is there something you need?"

Before any of the girls answered, she noticed Harry dressed in his sheet. [b]"What is the meaning of this insult?" she asked.

"Harry refuses to wear glasses, to take his education seriously. The sheet is part of his punishment, he has also been banned from using magic."

"I find his presence offensive"

"I am sure you do, I would if I was in your place."

"Why did you bring him here?"

"To explain that as a boy in elf clothing, he is no longer worthy of the respect that you customarily show humans. You are not to give him anything, no aid, no support. He does not deserve the aid of house elves,"

"He will not get it either, not whilst he dresses like one of us."

"That won't change, he will never take off that pillow case."

The older girl had been watching proceedings on the sofa and after a few minutes she closed her book, got up out of her armchair and walked over to the sofa.

"Is he a comfortable seat?" she asked then.

"Yes, Harry is very comfortable" Hermione confirmed "would you like to join us?" Hermione had seen how interested in what they were doing to Harry, she had a fair idea of what the older girl was working up to.

"Yes, may I sit on his head please?"

"Sure you can" Hermione confirmed "Harry, turn your head towards her so you don't smother when this girl sits on you."

"Call me Emily" the girl informed her as Harry dutifully turned his head towards her. Parvati and Lavender both offered their names in response.

"Don't be gentle" Parvati advised her "we aren't being gentle. We are sitting firmly upon him."

"I don't intend to be gentle, I intend to crush his head" Emily informed them.

"Go right ahead" Hermione advised "once Harry has asked you politely to sit on him of course."

There was an implicit instruction in Hermione's comment and Harry responded by saying "Please will you sit on my head, Emily."

"I'd love to" Emily giggled as she turned so that her back was towards him, then she pushed the back of her dress aside and sat down heavily upon his head, letter her dress drop back in to place and forming a kind of tent around him that hid his head from view completely, her knees emerged from one end of the tent and her feet dangled in front of her, not touching the floor as she was putting her full weight on Harry's head.

Harry could feel her sitting on him, and if he had his glasses on then he might have had a nice view of the back of her knees for a moment, but when she covered him with her dress, he was plunged into pitch darkness. It was clear to him though, that Emily was heavier than any of the first year girls, she was older than the three other girls and she appeared to be making good on her promise to crush his head for he was finding it more than a little painful.

"Do you often sit on boys?" Parvati asked her.

"No, but I saw you sitting on Harry in the great hall, the idra of sitting on him intrigued me."

"Oh, we sit on him in classes too" Parvati added "but Hermione sits on him more than the rest of us."

"You sit on him during classes?"

"Yes, McGonagall has informed him that he should spend all of his classes being used as our seat cushion."

"How did you get McGonagall to agree to that? She seems so straight-laced?"

"She is, but she doesn't like people goofing off during her lessons. Harry is refusing to wear his glasses any more and McGonagall has seen us sitting on him during meals as you have, and I had sat on him during Snape's class. McGonagall thinks that by forcing Harry to be sat upon during his classes that she might encourage him to buck his ideas up."

"Why was he goofing off?"

"He is refusing to wear his glasses any more, he does normally in fact he is famous for it. Actually he is famous anyway but it is generally known that he wears glasses."

"Famous? Harry? Glasses? This is Harry Potter isn't it?"

"Yes. Of course he will never wear his glasses, so unless McGonagall withdraws her punishment we will spend all of our lessons sitting on him."

"McGonagall is not known for going back on her word."

"That is true" Hermione smiled "it seems Harry that you will spend all of your lessons being sat upon by girls."

"Maybe tht was what McGonagall had in mind all along" Lavender mused.

"What makes you say that?" Hermione asked her.

"Well she didn't exactly object when you sat on him after the sorting. I wonder if she'd have batted an eyelid if you had sat on him when the hat was deciding his house."

"I was tempted" Hermione confessed "but I didn't think they'd let me. I would have been fun though, for Harry to be the focus of everyone in the great hall whilst I sat on him the entire time, especially if we could pursuade the hat to delay its decision for a few minutes."

"Hatstalls are usually boring" Emily commented "but I would have loved to have watched that one."

"Hatstalls?" Parvati asked her.

"When the sorting hat takes a long time choosing someone's house, it delays the sorting and people tend to lose interest. I think the record is somewhere near half an hour."

"I could have sat there for half an hour" Hermione added "I could have sat there for four hours if necessary."

"I'm sure you could, I could too."

"So when did you first sit on Harry?" Emily asked "clearly it was before the sorting. Did you two know each other before Hogwarts?"

"We first met on the train coming here" Hermione informed her "but as soon as I saw him, I know that I had to sit on him... so I did."

"He was on the boat we joined when we crossed the lake" Lavender continued "Hermione was already sitting on him but the three of his have been sharing him ever since. Hermione sits on him most though, technically he belongs to her."

"Belongs to her?"

"Essentally yes" Harmione nodded "I made him an offer he couldn't refuse and he has been magically bound to me ever since. He now can not refuse any instruction I give him, he is mine."

"What was the offer?" Emily was intrigued, this was a first year girl and she had somehow effectively enslaved the famous Harry Potter.

"I told him that if he agreed to do whatever I told him to do, then I might help him to pass his end-of-year exams."

"You might help him, so you made no promise?"

"No, I don't have to do a thing, and in return Harry has given himself to me completely by bonds of magic. Even the staircases have reversed for him. Most boys can't get into the girls' dorm as you know, but in his case the staircase that collapses when he tries to climb it is the one that leads to the boys' dorms, those rooms are closed to him now. He must now sleep with us girls instead."

Emily giggled at that. "Are you going to help him out, as you said you might?"

"I don't know, Harry seems incapable of learning anything, a trait he seems to have developed over the years mixed with natural cluelessness I'd say. Still, I do want him to advance with the rest of us so that we can continue to sit on him during our classes."

"Maybe you won't have to" Lavender ofered "if McGonagall wants us to keep sitting on him, she isn't likely to hold him back. She might even let him advance even if he fails all of his exams, simply so he can stay with us."

"We should check with her though" Parvati added "I don't want any nasty surprises at the end of the year."

"Agreed" Hermione responded "if McGonagall can assure as that Harry will be staying with us, then I won't bother teaching him anything. It's not like he can do anything anyway. Without his glasses or his wand he is incapable of performing any magic at all."

"No, glasses or wand?"

"I took his glasses from him, they are locked away now and he will never get them back. As for his wand, he broke that himself and gave pieces to each of the three of us."

"Why did he do that?"

I told him to, Harry will do anything I tell him. I knew he wouldn't need his wand any more. He is forbitten to use magic now anyway."

"Was that a part of McGonagall's instruction."

"Yes, as well as serving as our seat cushion basically forever, he is not allowed to use magic without his glasses and he is commanded to dress only in the pillow case he is wearing now, just like a house elf."

"Did you plan all of this from the start?"

"Not exactly, but it has worked out perfectly. McGonagall has played Harry into my hands, or rather under my backside and he will stay there for the rest of his life. I did pull a few strings though."

"For a first year girl, you are something of a genius" Emily stated.

"She really is the smartest girl I have ever known" Lavender admitted. Parvati agreed.

A moment later, the portrait door entered and it was the Head of House Professor McGonagall who entered this time.

She glanced around the room at this point before announcing "I strongly suggest you all get yourselves up to bed." Time was after all marching on at this point, and the few stragglers who remained in the common room were for the most part the night owls who were the last ones to depart to their dorms.

Of course, Professor McGonagall was quickly obeyed and within minutes the room had emptied apart from the four girls and Harry who were occupying that one sofa.

"You four should depart as well" she advised "and you should take Potter with you."

"Can we ask you a few questions first please" Hermione asked, finding a perfect opportunity to raise what was to her a very important query.

"Very well Miss Granger" she nodded, moving to take a nearby seat.

"Would you like to sit on my lap, Professor" Emily asked then.

"That is highly irregular, Miss Cooper" McGonagall pondered "but then we are alone, I guess. I see you too have claimed Potter as your seat."

"Yes, Professor, I am sitting on his head. You might like to join me."

"Why would I do that?" the professors' voice seemed to lack some of its earlier conviction though.

"Clearly you feel that Harry deserves to be sat upon" Lavender pointed out "you said that Harry would be our seat cushion until he agrees to wear his glasses again."

"Yes, I saw Harry being sat upon by Miss Granger, and that the two of you were keen to join her."

"If you are going to instruct others to sit on him, isn't it fair that you do so yourself as well."

"You don't bat an eyelid when I was sitting on him during the feast, and that was before you sought to punish him" Hermione added.

"Very well" the professor added "are you sure you can cope with me on your lap, Miss Cooper?"

"I'll be fine, Professor"

"Then I accept your offer" Professor McGonagall then took her seat upon Emily's lap and Harry who was now under both the girl and the woman felt like his head was suddenly being crushed in a vice.

"So what did you want to ask me?" the professor asked.

"Well, firstly there is a small question mark hanging over Harry's future." Hermione began."

"You know Harry's future" McGonagall informed her "whilst he refuses to take his education seriously, he will be spending all his lesson time under the three of you."

"Yes, but Parvati, Lavander and I who are working on our studies are going to progress to second year and beyond. Isn't it school policy that students who don't work can be kept back a year?"

"Yes, normally."

"If Harry is kept back then it won't be possible for us to sit on him during our classes next year."

"Ah, I see your point then. Very well, in Harry's case he will continue to serve as your seat cushion during classes whilst he maintains this defiance of his. He is after all not allowed to perform magic, so what class he happens to attend is a moot point isn't it? If he starts to apply himself, then we can evaluate his situation.

"So even when we are third and fourth years, we will still sit on him during our lessons."

"Yes, Miss Patil."

"Thank you, professor."

"Hermione has said that I can sit on Harry sometimes too" Emily added.

"As you are doing right now" Miss Cooper "you may not share classes with Potter, but I look forward to seeing him under you at other times."

"During the holidays, will Harry be allowed to come home with me?" Hermione asked.

"Well, you see Miss Granger, Harry is safe whilst he is with his parents, he is protected..." she stopped there, on the verge of revealing something she didn't want to discuss in front of four young girls.

"From You Know Who?" Parvati asked "he's dead, everyone knows he died years ago, That is why Harry here is so famous."

"Well, Professor Dumbledore thinks he may..." she stopped again, she didn't want to tell them that Dumbledore suspected that Voldemort could return.

Hermione was quick to pick up these little slips though, she had pieced together what the professor was saying in her own mind.

"The Dursleys hate him, professor. I know he will be in a far better position if he comes home with me."

"That position would be."

"Under me, yes. Isn't that the greatest transfiguration of all, Professor. I have transformedthe Boy Who Lived into my own personal seat cushion. You have said that Harry will serve as our seat during classes, wouldn't it be logical to keep him that way during the holidays?"

"I'd like to say yes, but...."

"Did you know that Harry slept in our dorm last night?" Parvati asked "the staircases have switched places for him. I can't get into the boys dorms professor, in the same way that the other boys can't get into ours?"

"Really? That's intereting."

"It is because he belongs to Hermione now, Professor" Lavender added "he is bound to her by some strong magical bond. If that bond is greater than what this Dursley family offer him, then perhaps you should consider Hermione's suggestion."

"Perhaps, okay I will look into tihs more thoroughly. You will have my decision on the matter in the next few days."

"Thank you, Professor" Hermione smiled.

"For now though, you should all get to bed" McGonagall stood up from Emily's lap "are you al right, Miss Cooper?"

"Yes, Professor"

"I will see what you say about Harry and the dormitories for myself though. Miss Patil, you will lead Harry up the stairs, I will follow behind shortly. If what you say is true then Harry will reach the landing at the top of the stairs, if not then the staircase will collapse and you will both fall to the bottom."

The girls all got up at that point and Parvati lifted Harry to his feet. Holding him farmly by the arm, she led him without incident up the stairs to their dormitory.

"I see" the professor remarked as she arrived at the top of the stair case a moment later, followed by Hermione, Lavender and Emily.

"That leads credence you your argument Miss Granger" she added "for now though I bid you all goodnight. The professor then went back downstairs then left the common room via the portrait entrance.

"Goodnight, Emily" Hermione added then "see you again soon."

"Goodnight, my friends" Emily added then she slipped through the door of the third years' dorm. Parvati, Hermione and Lavender then entered their own, with Harry.

As the girls, with Harry approached the Great Hall, they met a now-familiar girl, although she looked a little different when she was dressed in her Hogwarts robes then when she was wearing that light blue dress the previous night.

"Hello again, Emily" Hermione greeted her "I take it you were waiting for us?"
"Yes, I would very much like to....."
"Sit on Harry? Of course you can. Harry, just as with Lavender and Parvati, you will allow Emily to sit on you whenever she has my permission and you will obey any instruction she gives you unless I tell you otherwise."
"Yes, Hermione"
"Thank you Hermione, come with me Harry."

Emily then took Harry by the hand and led him in to the Great Hall, to where there was a gap at the Gryffindor table.
"Sit down here Harry, so I can sit on you" she advised him. Harry took his place, and then a moment latter Emily settled herelf into place upon him.
Harry was once again reminded that Emily, whilst not overweight was heavier than the younger girls.
Hermione and Partvati took places either side of Emily, squashing Harry between them and Lavender sat on the other side of Hemrione.

"I didn't recognise you in your school robes, Emily" Lavender admitted.
"I like to change out of my robes after dinner, it makes for a nice, comfortable wind down in the evening."
"There can be nothing more comfortable than sitting on Harry" Parvati added.
"That is true" Emily giggled.

Soon breakfast arrived and the girls started filling their plates. "What does Harry eat?" Emily asked then.
"Don't give him much, he doesn't have much of an appetite."
"A single slice of toast then?"
"That'll be fine."
As the girls at a hearty breakfast, Emily just passed Harry a single slice of dry toast.

Whilst they were eating, an owl flew through the window and dropped a newspaper in front of Emily. She in turn thanked the owl and dropped a few small bronze knuts into a pouch which was strapped to the owl's foot. Once it was paid, the owl flew away.

"Just the daily prophet" Emily remarked then she glanced down at the headline on the front page."
"Listen to this" she remarked then she recalled the story of a vault at Gringotts bank being broken into, a vault which had been recently emptied."
"That's the vault Hagrid and I went to" Harry remarked from beneath her. Hermione didn't say much but she had come to the conclusion that the thief was after whatever Hagrid had taken from that vault. Other than that though, there was little information.

It wasn't long though before a familiar snowy owl arrived with a letter for Hermione. [b]"Hello Hedwig" she petted the bird that was now her owl, she offered Hedwig an owl treat before she too flew off.

Hermione took the letter and opened it, having scanned the letter she in turn read it aloud for the benefit of the other girls.

-------
Hermione

We have not met but it seems we have a common interest, Harry. It seems though that you got to him first. I bear you no grudge for this, it was perhaps inevitable since you are he are in the same year, whilst I have to wait another year before I start at the school.

You tell me he is under your protection, but you are not the only person who has written to my family since Hogwarts started. I have seen Percy's letter to mother, he speaks of a girl from Gryffindor house who has taken to sitting on Harry on a regular basis. I assume you are the girl he mentions. I therefore feel on hesitation in revealing all this to you.

Congratulations, you got there ahead of me. Please tell me, is he as comfortable a seat cushion as I had hoped he would be? When I saw him at Kings Cross, I even asked my mother if I could board the train and see him, but she wouldn't let me. If I had been allowed then I would have joined Harry in his compartment and sat on him for the entire journey to Hogsmeade, where I would have visited one of the shops in the village and returned home via floo powder.

It is such a shame I can't sit on him at the school yet, that was perhaps the flaw in the plan. Maybe if we had met on the train we could have planned the next stage between us but now it is I who would ask a favour of you.

Would you like to visit me at my home over Christmas and bring Harry with you? I'm sure we can find a use for him. Would there be some way for me to visit the school sometime soon? I would still very much like to sit on Harry and I would hope I don't have to wait a year for the oppotunity.

As for my brother Ron, the family have disowned him and so have I. I haven't decided what to do about him yet, but I might ask a few favours of you at some point, do you know any good curses?

Here is a photgraph of me, please stay in touch and keep me informed of Harry's progress. I would particularly love a photo of you sitting on him.

Regards
Ginny
-------

"Isn't that great, Harry" Hemione grinned "apparently Ron's younger sister also wants to sit on you, perhaps we should find a way to arrange that."

She looked at the photograph, it was of a red haird girl and she was sitting at the dressing table in her bedroom. She was smiling and waving at Hermione, and she seemed particularly entertained by Harry's position under Emily. Hemrione could see from the picture that Ginny meant what she said, she really did want to sit on Harry.

"What do you mean by that, Hermione? asked Ginny.

"Did Ron not t ell you the full details of why Harry was at your house part of the summer? Before he came to your house, his own relatives had put bars on his windows and his door had a cat-flap on it to enter food to his room. He was like an animal in a cage."

"You told her, Ron?" asked Harry.

"Harry, have you always been in that room?" asked Hermione, interrupting Ron's response.

Harry looked embarrassed and started mumbling.

"We can't hear you, Harry. Speak up!" said Hermione.

"Before I started getting my Hogwarts letters, which it took a while before I was able to read one, I lived in the cupboard under the stairs."

"The same one that they locked your school supplies in?"

"Yes" said Harry in an embarrassed voice.

"See what I mean, Ginny? He's never been treated as a human by the Dursleys since he's lived there. He never slept in a real bed until a year ago! It's why he follows others, he doesn't know to think for himself. He is an animal."

"I see your point, Hermione" replied Ginny as she also started to see Harry in a new light.

"Ok, this conversation is starting to get really weird" said Ron in an uncomfortable voice. "I'm heading to bed."

As Ron left to go upstairs while thinking about what Hermione said, Harry stood rooted to the spot.

"You're wrong, Hermione. I'm not an animal."

"Are you sure, Harry?" Hermione asked as she stepped up to Harry and lightly scratched behind Harry's ear, which Harry got a shudder of delight at the motion. "I can take care of you, you know. I'm not reckless like Ron. I won't get you killed. I think you would make a nice pet."

Harry backed away from Hermione as he was trying to ignore Hermione's words. Harry looked frazzled as he ran upstairs to his dorm.

"I'd say that went well" said Hermione to Ginny.

"He wouldn't have that reaction if he didn't at least partially believe you. Good night" replied Ginny as she headed upstairs to enjoy her new room for the first time.

"God night" replied Hermione, sticking around a bit to see if Harry was kicked out of his room or not.

1213111.content:
A moment later, Hermone heard the sound of footsteps on the boys' staircase once more as Harry returned to the common room.

"It was horrible" Harry whined "Ron has been telling Dean and the others that I have agreed to be your pet, and they were all laughing out loud. It was awful, they were laughing and jeering at me, then Ron and I got into an argument and the other boys all sided with him. They told me that as I was now your pet, I could bloody well sleep in your room."

"Of course you can, I've got a nice bed already prepared for you."

"I can't, you know that. Boys aren't allowed in the girls' dorms."

"How many galleons would you like to wager on that? You're a pet now Harry, different rules apply."

"I'm still a boy, boys can't get up your staircase."

"Ten galleons says you can"

"Ten galleons?"

"The price has just gone up to fifty, do you accept or shall I keep adding to the pot, Potter?" She grinned a little at that."

"Sixty galleons" Hermione added after a moment.

"You probably don't even have sixty."

"It doesn't matter, Harry. I know this is a bet I can't lose. Shall we keep putting it up until everything in your Gringotts vault is on le line?"

"What if I refuse to bet."

"You can't Harry. You are my pet. I can force you to do as I say with a single command. For now I am asking but if you waste much more time then I will order you to comply."

"Fine, fine. Sixty galleons it is."

"Very good Harry, upstairs now." Her voice had taken on the tone of command as she indicated the girls' staircase.

Harry sighed, He started mounting the stairs with Hermione climbing right behind him, making sure he did as she ordered.

"That's sixty galleons you owe me, Harry" she purred when they reached the top "we'll write to Gringotts tomorrow and tell them to transfer the funds." Hermione had no doubt that soon all of Harry's money would be hers, pretty much as soon as she had made him her permanent pet.

Hermione led him to the second door on the left, the second year girls' dorm. As they passed the first door, Harry could hear the voices of girls chatting and giggling amongst themselves, and he recognised Ginny among them. Just what was she telling the other first years?

As they entered the second year girls' dorm, Harry noticed there was a dog-sized pet basket next to one of the beds. Noticing where he was looking, Hermione nodded. "My bed, your bed" she indicated the two. Clearly the dog bed on the floor was meant for Harry.

"I won't fit in there" Harry complained.

"Yes, you will" Hermione laughed "I enchanted it for you, you'll fit perfectly my pet."

"You're nuts, Hemrione" Harry muttered.

"Would you like to give me sixty more galleons?" she asked him "go lay down in your new bed. Harry."

Harry shook his head. He had already lost one bet, he didn't want to risk losing any more money and Herminoe was sounding just a little too smug. He didn't have to put money on the line this time though, it was obvious he was too big to fit in that bed. A clear demonstration would be enough to humiliate her this time.

He deliberately wandered over to the dog bed and stepped onto it. Surely his own boy-size compared to that tiny bed would be enough.

The moment he stepped onto the bed though, something seemed terribly wrong, the bed was suddenly so much bigger than it had appeared a moment ago. Hermione didn't look any bigger though, why was the bed suddenly so large?

"Lay down, Harry" she instructed, and Harry curled up in his new bed, expecting it to be far too small for him, but in actuality he somehow had plenty of room.

"It is a simple expanding charm" Hermione told him "your bed will magically grow to the right size whenever you get into it, but the effect is only noticeable from within the bed. The effect not unlike a magical tent that is much bigger on the inside, or a bag that has had an engorgement charm placed upon it so you could fit far more inside than a similar sized normal bag. From here, your bed looks no bigger than normal but you appear to be no smaller than an average sized dog."

Harry nodded, he should have suspected that magic was involved somehow.

"Now stay, Harry. You will not leave your bed until I let you out."

With that, Hermione got ready for bed herself, and in a few minutes, dressed in her night clothes, she had slipped under the covers.

The next day...

12131112.content:
Harry was awoken the next morning by the feel of Hermione shaking him a bit and saying, "Get up, Harry. It's time for you to use the restroom."

"W-what are you doing in my room, Hermoine?" said a sleepy Harry.

"Think again, Harry. This is the second years girls' dorm. You were kicked out of your old room, remember?"

At those words,Harry remembered what happened the night before, from Hermione saying she wanted him as her pet, to being kicked out of his dorm, and then sleeping in Hermione's room...in a dog basket.

"I remember now, Hermione," replied Harry in a low voice as he felt embarrassed at last night's events.

"Good. Now I expect you to go the restroom. Just because you're now my pet does not mean you are going to just go whenever or wherever you want as some pets do."

Harry felt anger as stood up from his bed. "Let's get one thing straight here! I have not agreed to be your pet and I never will be!"

Hermione smirked at Harry and replied, "But you will, Harry. Hogwarts has already accepted you as my pet and soon, you will realize that you are not a human, you are a pet. My pet."

Harry didn't reply as he left to go to the restroom. As he was leaving, his wand fell out of his pocket and Hermione picked it up. When Harry returnedto the dorm room, he saw Hermione holding his wand.

"Give that back, Hermione! That wand is mine!"

"Are you sure about that, Harry? Sure it was your wand, but will it still work for you now that you're my pet? I think this wand would rather have me as it's owner, not you."

"C-cut that nonsense," said Harry with a slight stammer. He was afraid that after all the recent changes, she could be right again.

"How about another bet? We'll both cast spells with the wand, and if it works better with me, I'll keep it for myself. If you win, you can keep it."

"There's no way-"

"Or I could just snap this wand in half, right here and now," threatened Hermione.

"Fine. I'll go along with your bet."

"Good. You're up first."

Hermoine then tossed his wand to Harry and he caught it. Harry felt very nervous; he could lose his first wand after all.

121311121.content:
Harry started out by trying to cast simple spells. He tried casting Lumos, he tried using a levitation charm to raise a cushion from one of the beds, neither of these seemed to have any effect. He used the correct word, the right wand motions but the wand remained silent and unresponsive in his hand.

He tried a few more spells, getting more and more desperate with each passing second. The more the wand failed to respond, the more he felt certain that he was about to lose it to Hermione. This fuelled his drive to succeed, he would get the wand to respond to him if it was the last thing he ever did.

Or so he hoped...

As the minutes passed, and the wand remained silent, Harry grew more and more desperate and in his frustration he started aiming his spells at hermione. The girl was clearly responsible, re reasoned. He was entirely justified in cursing her.

If only he could.

He spoke curse after curse into his wand but regardless of his cries for attention, the wand continued to sleep in his hand.

He tried to bind her in magical ropes. The wand refused to act.
He tried to cast a full body bind.... nothing.
He attempted a stunnder. Hermione remained on her feet and entirely mobile.

"My turn" she called eventually, snatching the wand from him.

Her first spell was Lumos. and the wand lit up like a Christmas tree.

She then fired several more spells off in succession, each one worked perfectly and with such strength that it was clear even to Harry that Hermione was clearly in control of (his?) wand.

Finally, she settled for an indisputable demonstration, she levitated Harry raising him high into the air until his entire body was pressed so firmly against the ceiling that he could not lower his arms or legs, he was pinned in place.

She held him there for around ten minutes before she finally lowered him to the ground.

"I guess that settles that" Hermione smiled, pocketing the wand.
121311121.title: Hermione wins the bet.

1213111211.content:
A moment after Hermione had pocketed the wand that had previously belonged to Harry, there was a short knock on the door, then the handle turned and someone came inside.

The person who walked in though was not a student, this was an adult witch wearing formal robes and a ministry insignia badge.

"Clarissa Cardon" the witch introduced herself "Department for Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures"

"What can I do for you minister?" Hemrione asked, politely.

"We have had a report that a non magical creature has attempted to use a wand here just now" the witch pointed out "has one of the school elves perhaps taken possession of a wand?"

"No ma'am" Hermione explained "Harry here was trying to use this wand a moment ago, that was all."

"I said non-human, young lady" the witch huffed.

"Yes, as my pet, Harry would register as non-human. I'll make sure he doesn't try to gain access to the wand again."

"Your pet?" The ministry witch was clearly unconvinced.

"I'll prove it. You carry a portable detector, I take it?"

"Yes."

"Then use it. When you are ready, I'll give Harry the wand back. We'll see what happens."

"Very well." The witch was clearly unconvinced, but then the young girl seemed very sure of herself. She took a small hand held device out of her pocket and studied it for a moment. "Nothing yet, give him the wand."

"Take the wand, Harry" Hermione instructed.

Harry refused at first. "This has got to be some sort of trick" he muttered.

"Are you accusing a ministry witch of deliberate deception, boy?" The witch frowned.

"No... I, erm."

"Take the wand, Harry" Hermione repeated "if you are human then you have nothing to hide."

Harry sighed and picked up the wand.

Immediately, the dial on the detector moved to the right and it started to make a whistling noise."

"Non-human" the witch repeated. That can not be, he looks human. Polyjuice?"

She took out her wand and cast a spell which would counter the effects of polyjuice potion. It had no effect.

"Well. It seems you may be right, young lady. Whatever the boy is, pet or not, he is clearly not human. The detector never lies. You should keep the wand until we determine what this 'boy' truly is.

"Yes ma'am" Hemrione nodded as the ministry witch left the room.

"I'd say that settles it, Harry Hermione smiled then. You really are my pet."

Harry felt absolutely defeated. Not only did his former wand not work for him, but worked for Hermione, even the Ministry apparently didn't see him as a human and that he was forbidden to use a wand!

"This can't be happening!" yelled out Harry in frustration. "When I first learned about magic and Hogwarts, I thought it'd be a new start to my life, a life where the Dursleys were out of my life for most of the year. But between all that happened first year, the Dursleys acting the worst they ever have the past summer, and now this? I just can't comprehend anything at the moment!"

Hermione remained silent for a few moments after Harry's rant before she spoke. "Would you rather return to the Dursleys, Harry?"

Harry looked at Hermione. "What?"

"You're not allowed to use a wand since you're a non-human, which means you aren't a student anymore. Given those circumstances, you can't remain at Hogwarts unless you agree to be my pet. Otherwise, you'd probably have to return to the Dursleys. Now, between accepting your fate as my pet or leaving the Wizarding World altogether to return to the Dursleys, which would you prefer?"

Harry stared at Hermione in shock, but when she had phrased it that way, he already knew his decision.

"I never want to return to the Dursleys. I didn't want to return after first year was over either. If becoming your pet is the only other alternative, then I'll...I'll become your pet, Hermione."

"Hermione, what are you doing, going through my clothes?" asked Harry.

"Well Harry did get better aat fetch and it looked like he was maybe even enjoting. He's earned a little break."

"Is that you want? Would you like a break?"

"Yes, please, Hermione," said Harry as he slowed his breathing down.

Harry didn't notice that Hermione then put his wand in her pocket as she...
