Because he found Tom Riddle's diary
122.content: Why does Ginny decide to dominate Harry?
122.title: Ginny.

choices: Harry loses the match and his broom.
1221.content:
Ginny was angry at Harry. She blamed him for getting her father in trouble with the Ministry for having their family car seen by Muggles. It also hurt because she has a crush on Harry and she saw this as a betrayal due to how much the Weasleys have done for him. Her anger was enough to snap her out of her shyness in front of Harry but it wasn't enough for her. She wanted revenge but she wanted it done in a unique way. She wanted Harry to see himself as inferior to her, Ron's little sister. Part of her was excited at the power she was going to have over the Boy-Who-Lived.

Ginny decided to start her plan that night in the Common Room. "Hello, Harry. Want to play Wizard Chess?" asked Ginny. She noticed that Harry, Hermione, and her brohers were shocked, knowing how she acted over the summer in front of him.

"Sure, Ginny" replied Harry. Although he knew Ron was very good at chess, he was not sure how good Giny was.

After an hour of playing, Harry knew Ginny was about as good as Ron.

"Wow, you sure at suck at chess, Harry" said a laighing Ginny after beating Harry three games in a row. Harry felt embarassed at hearing Ron's younger sister laugh at him.

"Ginny, that's not nice" remarked Hermione.

Ginny ignored her and said "I wonder who's a better Seaker. I've secretly been practicing most of my life at home and you've only been flying for one year. I've got more experience."

Playing Quidditch was Harry's favorite thing to do. Sure he was relatively new to the sport, but he was still undefeated and he couldn't back down from the hidden challenge.

"You think so, Ginny? Let's go right now." challenged Harry as he went upstairs to get changed and get his broom. His friends were shocked at what happened and when the 2 left for the challenge, they left to watch.
1221.title: As punishment for stealing the family car

choices: They go back to the Common Room.
12211.content:
Soon the group of 6 (Harry, Hermione, Ginny, Ron, Fred, and George) made it to the Quidditch Field.

Fred and George got 100 golf balls and they were going to throw the balls. Whoever could catch the most balls out of 100 (while flying Harry's broom as it was better than the school brooms) won the challenge.

Before they started, Ginny decided to make it into a bet. "Harry, let's make this interesting. If I win, I keep your broom. And if you win, then you can have my diary."

"The same diary that you protect constantly?" asked Fred. "But surely you've written your deepest secrets into it."

"The same one. What do you say, Harry?"

"But what would I do for the games? I can't play without my broom." reason Harry.

"Well then you better win. However, if I win, then I'm the better Seeker and I might as well talk to Oliver Wood and take your place. After all, you were a first year when you got on the team. Why can't I?" asked Ginny. She knew if she won, this would be a huge blow to Harry's ego and confidence. That's why she kept raising the stakes for what would happen if she won; Harry wouldn't be able to back down after that. She also figured it might make Harry nervous and choke during the bet.

"Okay Ginny" replied Harry after a moment. "If you win, you get my broom and my spot on the Quidditch team."

"Excellent!" said Ginny as she shook his hand. "I'll go first then."

When they were in position, Fred started throwing the golf balls and to everyone's amazement, she caught them all.

"I guess you have to be perfect Harry to force a tiebreaker, otherwise I get your broom" said Giny in a sing-song voice.

Harry then swalowed and got into postion. Fred started throwing the balls and at first, Harry was doing fine. But then Ginny's voice got into his head and he got nervous at what would happen if he lost. He didn't even notice when he missed one, causing everyone to gasp and Ginny to get a huge smile. After all the balls were thrown, Harry said "I guess that's it. I got them all."

"What are you talking about, Harry?" asked Fred in a surprised voice. "You missed 10 of them!"

"What?" repled Harry. He was so consumed by his thoughts that he didn't notice himself missing one of them, let alone 10. He looked at Ginny and saw her huge smile. He lowered down to the ground where she was. "A bet's a bet. You're the better Seeker" mumbled Harry as he looked down to the ground and handed his broom, one of his favorite possessions, to its new owner.

"Why thank you, Harry. It's nice to hear you graciously accept your defeat at someone who is better than you at Quidditch" said Ginny in a condescending voice. Everyone else was stunned at the turn of events and Ginny's new attitude of wanting to beat Harry at stuff.

Harry felt ashamed. Playing Quidditch was his favorite thing to do and now he lost that privilege to Ginny in a bet. By lunch the next day, the whole school would know about the bet and that there was a new Gryffindor Seeker. He was starting to feel scared of Ginny. What other things would she prove to him that she was better at?
12211.title: Harry loses the match and his broom.

122111.content:
The group of 6 left to the Common Room in slience until they got to the Fat Lady an said the password. When they got there, they noticed the Common Room was empty and then Hermione, Ron, Fred, and George left to go to bed, still shocked at what happened.

Harry and Ginny stood there alone for a minute before Ginny simply said "Sit" as she sat down.

Harry was scared of Ginny now so he did as he was told to Ginny's happiness.

"Harry, why don't you give my neck and feet a massge? It would feel so good to get one by the person I just beat at Quidditch, don't you think?" finished Ginny with a small smile.

"That wasn't part of the bet! I'm not going to do it" yelled Harry as he stood up.

Ginny got a scowl on her face as she pointed her wand t Harry and yelled "Expelliarmus!" which sent Harry's wand out of his hands and towards Ginny as she caught it in her free hand.

"Now let's try this again. You don't give me a massage and I snap your wand to match Ron's. Got it?" threatened Ginny.

"I got it" said Harry in a small voice. Ginny just deefeated him in an unofficial duel. He had no idea that wands can change masters and with that, Ginny took control of Harry's wand. He would find out soon that his magical ability would suffer by using "his" wand.

Harry went over to Ginny and gave her neck, shoulders, and feet a nice, long massage. Ginny had a huge smile on her face.

"That was a good job, Harry" replied Ginny a half-hour later. "Maybe I should have you give me a massage every night from now on."

Harry had no energy to protest and said "Sure. Can it be when no one's around?" Harry could tell that Ginny was taking over his liife and there was nothing he could do to stop it.

"Hmmm. I suppose we can keep it private for a while , but soon I'll have you do it regardless of who's in the Common Room." Ginny noted Harry's lack of protest and took advantage by declaring he had no real say in the matter anymore.

Harry silently nodded and headed to go to upstairs.

"Where do you think you're going?" demanded Ginny.

"Going to bed."

"Did I say you go to bed?"

"No. I didn't think -" started Harry.

"That's right. You didn't think. You don't go to bed until I head up to bed. Luckily for you, I'm heading to bed as well, so you can go as well." ordered Ginny.

"Yes, Ginny" said Harry as he headed up to bed while Ginny was going to bed.
122111.title: They go back to the Common Room.

choices: Ginny goes all out with her old clothes that anyone could see.
1221112.content:
The next morning, Harry couldn't look at Ginny in the eyes after all that happened last night. Luckily for him, she didn't speak to him, so nothing happened at breakfast. Although, word got out about the Quidditch bet and people were laughing at him in the hallways.

But that was only the beginning. Harry went to Charms and found himself struggling more than usual with his classwork. He was struggling even doing the stuff he could already do.

"Is something wrong, Harry? Are you sick?" asked Hermione when they left.

"No. I'm fine. I must be having a bad day is all" said Harry as he tried to get Hermione to let it go even though he was also wondering what was wrong.

They went to Transfiguration next and the same thing happened again. Not only couldn't he do what he was supposed to do, he could barely do his first year knowledge stuff. Panicing, Harry decided to talk to Professor McGonagall after class. He assured Ron and Hermione that he didn't need them before they left.

"Mr. Potter, is something wrong? You're performing worse than you normally do" aske Professor McGonagall.

"I don't know. For some reason my wand isn't doing what it normally does" wondered Harry.

"Hmmm. The only thing I can think of is if you lost your wand in a duel." replied Profesor McGonagall. "If that's the case, then your wand rightly belongs to whomever took it from you."

"Wands can change masters?!" esclaimed Harry.

"Yes. Even a simple Expelliarmus can cause it to change hands if the caster caught it in their hands. Even if the winner gave it back willingly, the wand won't recognize you as the owner unless you defeated that person in a duel and forcefully took your wand back." said Professor McGonagall.

"You could say I lost a duel" said Harry in a soft voice.

"Who defeated you?" asked Professor McGonagall.

"Ginny Weasley. We argued and she cast Expelliarmus on me and took my wand."

"I see" said a shocked McGonagall. "I would suggest talking to Miss Weasley and telling her this. If I'm not mistaken, she's using a hand-me-down wand. Perhaps you can use that wand until you can go to Ollivander's again. It may or may not be better than your old wand but at least your old wand will be with its new owner."

"Yes, Professor McGonagall" replied Harry in a sad voice. Another thing of Harry's that he lost to Ginny. When he left, he saw Ginny in the crowd and decided to talk to her now.

"Ginny!" said Harry when he was close. "Can we talk...privately?"

"Sure, Harry" said Ginny in a confused voice. "Lead the way to an unused classroom."

When they found an empty room, Harry explained what was going on with his wand and by the end Ginny was laughing.

"You mean to tell me that I am the new owner of your wand because of a simple Expelliarmus and me catching it? And that I don't have to use my hand-me-down wand anymore?"

"Yes, that's right. Professor McGonagall said that I should use your hand-me-down wand until the next time I'm in Diagon Alley and ask Ollivander for a new one."

Ginny stopped laughing at this. "Oh no, Harry. I don't think so. I think you should keep my old wand" started Ginny as she put her old wand in his hand and took Harry's old wand in her hand; indeed, Harry's old wand felt perfect for her. "That way, you can always remember why you don't have your original wand anymore. Think of it as another reminder that I am better than you. After all, you're getting my hand-me-downs. In fact, how about I give you more hand-m-downs from me? You're small, so you can probably fit into my clothes that I don't want anymore" said a now excited Ginny.

Harry had a horrified expression as Ginny grabbed Harry's hand and raced to the Gryffindor Common Room. Ginny's words of her being better than him ringed in his ears. Harry was starting to believe it. He was inferior to Ron's little sister.
1221112.title: Next day at class.

choices: Harry and Ginny go to lunch.
Harry and Ginny go to their classes.
12211121.content:
When Harry and Ginny got to the Common Room, Ginny whispered to Harry to go to his room and that she'll be there in a moment. Harry just nodded and left for his room. He was lucky that no one was in his room at the time. He waited what seemed like forever before Ginny came back with a small box.

"Hello, Harry. Since you have my hand-me-down wand, why not give you my old underwar as well? I don't want them anymore, but at least they'll be going to a good home" said Ginny in a condescending voice.

Harry just stared as she pulled out a dozen underwear that was dark pink with little red hearts over it. She handed a pair and said "Put them now. I awnt to see them on you."

Harry gulped as he took the pair of Ginny's old underwear and went to his bed before closing the curtains and changing. Ginny was laughing her head off at this point. She could not imagine her plan would be working so fast and easy Harry was starting to own her possessions that she didn't want anymore.

Not longer after, Harry came out of his bed in nothing but her old underwear. Ginny lost it. "Oh, it fits even better than I thought. It's a perfect fit! Since you have new underwar, you have no need for your old underwear anymore, right?" asked a smirking Ginny. She took all his old underwear and went downstairs and, seeing that she was alone, put them all in the fireplace.

Ginny returned to Harry's room and said "I burned your old underwear in the fireplace. My old underwear is what you'll be wearing from now on" said Ginny as she pinched his cheek, enjoying Harry's predicament. Harry felt embarrassed at how much power Ginny was asserting over him.
12211121.title: Ginny starts with hand-me-down underwear.

choices: Harry and Ginny go to lunch.
122111212.content:
After Harry put on his robes again, it was time for class. Harry had History of Magic while Ginny had Transfiguration before lunch.

They walked together out of Gryffindor Tower, but before they were to split, Ginny had a thought.

"Harry, do you know how good you arer with your new wand?" asked Ginny as she had a brilliant idea.

"No, I don't, Ginny. I just got it, remember?" replied Harry.

"I think we need to talk to Professor McGonagall after our classes are done."

"Why?"

"I think it would be best if we talked to our Head of House about your...situation", said Ginny vaguely.

"Fine" said Harry and Ginny smiled at that.

"Meet me at Professor McGonagall's after we're done with our classes" finished Ginny as she smiled, ready to put her plan into action.

Harry felt uncomfortable, wanting no one to see his new underwear. Soon enough, History was over and he left the class before Ron and Hermione could talk to him. Soon enough, he came to Professor McGonagall's classroom with Ginny and McGonagall inside.

"Nice to see you, Harry" answered McGonagall. "I see you've already told Ginny about the wands. I must say the wand fits her well."

Harry merely nodded, missing his wand.

"Now Ginny, what did you want to say about this?" asked McGonagall.

"Well, Professor McGonagall, I'm just worried that with my old hand-me-down wand, Harry won't be able to keep up with his 2nd year classes. He might even struggle with his 1st year classes. I understand he barely passed Potions, Herbology, and History as it is with his wand. It might not be a bad idea to put him back as a 1st year." said Ginny in a fake concerned voice.

Harry was shocked while Professor McGonagall actually took a moment to think about this. "Yes. You have a point. At the earliest, Harry won't be able to get a wand until next summer and that's a school year away. Mr. Potter, I'm going to have to ask you to do some 1st year Transfiguration and Charms. If you do poorly enough, along with you poor grades from your other classes in your 1st year, I'm going to have you replaced you as a 1st year."

Harry was still shocked. This had to be Ginny's plan all along. If they were both 1st years, they would share all their classes together and thus he'd be spending more time with her while slowly distancing himself from Ron and Hermione. Ginny wanted to monopoloize as much of his time as she could. But at the same time, he understood he couldn't argue that his magic suffered without his old wand.

"Okay, Professor McGonagall. Let's do this."

After twenty minutes, it was clear that Harry was struggling with 1st year spells and Professor McGonagall told him he was replaced in 1st year and given a new schedule. She also informed him that she would be telling the staff this at lunch.

Harry and Ginny then left her classroom with Ginny in front and Harry behind. Ginny noticed this and said "From now on, whenever we walk together (and we will walk together for every class and meal now), you are to walk behind me. You don't deserve to walk beside me as an equal. After all, I would never be bumped down a grade" said Ginny with a smile. she was lovng at the downward spiral that Harry's life was becoming.

Harry was silent at this new change. The one thing he had over Ginny, that he was older than her, was effectively nullified by him being placed in her grade. Not only that, but with what Professor McGonagall was implying, Ginny was doing better in her 1st year classes than he would be very soon. It would be confirmed soon that she was better than him at school.
122111212.title: Harry and Ginny go to their classes.

choices: Harry makes a grab for one of Ginny's sandwiches
Hermione looks over and notices where Ginny is sitting
1221112121.content:
Harry continues to walk behind Ginny as she leads him towards the Great Hall for their lunch. Ginny did not walk too briskly, she wanted Harry to keep up after all but at one point he did slow his pace and a slight gap appeared between them. He could now clearly see the back of her robes and the swaying of her body as she walked. Even at this age it appeared her movements were feminine and graceful.

"Stay close, Harry" she warned him without even turning her head, apparently aware of the gap that had started to emerge between them "you don't want to lose sight of me, you could easily get lost in a place like this if I am not here to look after you."Apparently now she was telling him that she was a young child who couldn't be trusted to wander off on his own whereas she clearly had no problem with it. Was this another means by which she was asserting her superiority over him?

It worked though, Harry quickly moved to catch up with her. Now he wa so close that if she lost her footing and tripped, she was likely to drop on him. She didn't though, instead she gave him a number of instructions regarding what should happen when they arrived.

"When we sit down to lunch" she informed him "you will wait for me to have my share before you take the meal that I offer you. This will be the same for all your meals from now on. Anybody can see you haven't eaten right before you came to Hogwarts, I will take that in hand for you Harry but out of gratitude you will wait for me to finish first. That is fair, after all."

"I suppose it is, yes" Harry approved, not seeing anything wrong with her argument so far.

They entered the Great Hal and Ginny led him to the Gryffindor table, where there was a reasonable sized gap available for them.

"Have a seat, Harry" she advised him "but don't touch any of the food until I am finished with my meal."

Harry dutifully took a seat at the table, as he had done countless times before, making sure there was room beside him for Ginny, as he assumed that she would want to sit next to him. She had been making a special point of keeping him close after all.

Apparently that wasn't quite what she had in mind.

Initially she came over to the space that Harry had offered her and started to sit down, then glanced at him sitting next to her, with a wicked gleam in her eye. "How do I make sure you don't run off whilst I am eating my lunch?" she mused "how do I keep you exactly where you are right now... oh of course..."

Smiling now, she moved across so that she was now directly in front of Harry, then she sat. She sat quickly and she sat forcibly, she sat directly upon Harry's waiting lap, and she stayed there. She sat with her back against him, her knees over his and bent so her feet hung loosely over his own but did not touch the floot. Her full weight was focused upon him as she sat and prepared to make a start on her meal.

"You make for a very comfortable seat cushion, Harry" she approved "not only are you beneath me at flying and quidditch, not only are you inferior to me magically, now you are literally under me as I eat my lunch. Now stay nice and still for me as I tuck into my lunch."

Harry noted that whilst Giny's weight was not extreme, it was probably enough to keep him in place and he suspected that this was indeed her intention. Her butt cheeks bore down firmly upon his lap, claiming him as her own and using him as her own personal chair. He noted that she felt quite warm too, and her nearness made him aware of a gentle feminine fragrance.

By now the food had arrived on the table and Ginny helped herself to whatever she fancied. It could certainly be said that nobody ever starved at Hogwarts, but Ginny reconsidered that, she could starve Harry if she wanted. It would be easy, she would just deny him his meals. She didn't want that though, not now anyway. She would keep him healthy, but she would control his diet the same as she was starting to control everything else about him. She would take the best parts of any meals and leave him with just the scraps, it was another way to demonstrate her superiority over him after all.
1221112121.title: Harry and Ginny go to lunch.

choices: Ginny takes Harry to his next lesson
Hermione looks over and notices where Ginny is sitting
12211121211.content:
Starting to feel hungry, as Ginny continued ot sit on him as she ate her own lunch. Harry reached over to try to snatch one of Ginny's sandwiches off her plate when he thought she wasn't looking.

It didn't work.

"That's mine, Harry" she told him, slapping him shaprly across the wrist.
It wasn't a gentle slap either. Clearly this girl had sone strength in her, he felt a ringing pain in his right hand from where she had slapped him.
"Oww" he cired "that hurts"
"Good. You will learn not to steal from me Harry, that will be a valuable lesson for you and I am happy to teach it."
"Alright, I'll keep my hands to myself."

This wan't enough for her though, Harry had tried to take her food once, she wouldn't be satisfied with just his word that he wouldn't try it again. She intended to enjoy her meal, which meant taking her time over it and not having to worry about what Harry might do.

"How can I be srue of that Harry?" she asked then "You have tried it once, I am not going to let you try it again."
"What are you going to do."
"I am going to immobilise your hands until after I have eaten."
"How?"

Ginny put down her food for a moment, took Harry's right hand in her own, and his left hand in her other one. She considered for a moment, this wouldn't do at all. If she was going to have her lunch then she was going to need to keep her hands free whilst keeping Harry's out of action. She thought for a moment, then she nodded.

Still holding both of Harry's hands, she pulled them under the table, at the same time she pulled her legs apart slightly which formed a slight gap between her knees. Into this gap she then lowered Harry's light-fingered hands then closed the gap between her legs, trapping Harry's hands between her knees. Allowing her knees and thighs to take of the strain of constraining Harry's hands, she enveloped them in her fleshy embrace, squeezing against them so that Harry had no hope whatsoever of using his hands until Ginny decided to give them back to him. She then took her own hands away from him and resumed her meal.

"You've lost your hands to me Harry" she informed him "I'll give them back to you after I have eaten but until that time they will remain where they are.

Harry felt himself utterly immobilsied. Not only had he effectively lost all use of his hands, the girl was still sitting just as firmly upon him and without the use of his hands he was sure there was not a thing he could do to stop her from sitting there as long as she wanted. Ginny was not squeezing them so firmly to cause him any physical pain but he couldn't move his hands at all and he was actualy starting to lose some sensation there.

He remained like that for some time whilst Ginny slowly finished her meal. She then found a number of leftover items that nobody had touched. Some soggy sandwiches that didn't look all that appetising, some stale looking cakes and various other items she wouldn't normally bother with but which would provide Harry with enough nutrition but not necessarily taste all that pleasant.

Once she had arranged his first 'meal' she waited until all the other plates vanished before finally releasing her grip on Harry's hands. "This is yours" she told him, handing him the plate but still not getting up from his lap "finish it quickly but don't give yourself indigestion. I don't want us to be late for our first class together."

Hary nodded and started on the food she had given him. His hands still felt numb from the time they had spent trapped in Ginny's leggy embrace. It took him a few minutes but eventually he managed to clear his plate.
12211121211.title: Harry makes a grab for one of Ginny's sandw...

choices: Ginny takes Harry to his next class
Ginny has a sudden urge to use the girls' toilets.
122111212112.content:
Hermione Granger was sitting a short distance away from Harry and Ginny, but when she looked over in their direction she noticed that there was clearly something between Ginny's butt cheeks and the Gryffindor bench... something, male and vaguely familiar. She looked puzzled for a second but then she realised just exactly where the younger girl was sitting and she came over to inquire further.

Ginny was familiar to Hermione of course, she had known that the girl was Ron's younger sister and had made a conscious effort to get to know here. She had found that the girl had a great deal of magical potention, as well as an agile mind and expert judgement. The two had soon become close friends, and they often discussed a number of topic that Ron and Harry were simply inequipped to understand, matters that only girls would ever really know.

"Is that Harry you are sitting on?" she asked as she herself took a seat nearby.

"Yes, of course"

"Why?"

Ginny shrugged. "It is an easy way to keep tabs on him, I can sit on him and not worry about him wandering off. I can enjoy my meal in peace knowing that he is in all respects beneath me, and besides.... he is comfy."

"He is?" Hermione raised an eyebrow "maybe I should.... "

She stopped herself, but Ginny could tell what she was going to say. "I've got him for now but we can talk about that later if you like."

"Does he mind at all?" Hermione wasn't yet prepared to do anything to Harry agaisnt his well or convince others to do likewise.

Harry for a moment thought of saying something to Hermione, but then he remembered that he was wearing Ginny's underclothes under his robes, she had taken his wand, his broom, his place on the quidditch team and a year from his magical education. He didn't feel all that empowered right now, quite the worse right now. He felt utterly inferior to the younger girl in every conceivable respect and considereing her position and the fact that he didn't trust the hand-me-down wand he had been given, he didn't want to upset her.

"No, it's fine" he commented, feeling that the girl had secured yet another hold on him with that one simple admission.

Ginny seemed pleased by his response, and Hermione was satisfied that there was no reason for her to try and interfere.

"I'll see you in class then Harry" Hermone informed him as she stood up and turned to leave the hall.

"No you won't" Ginny giggled

"Sorry?" Surely Harry would still be taking his lessons wouldn't he.

"You won't see him in class. In fact I doubt neither you nor Ron will ever see him in class again."

"Why ever not?"

Ginny decided to let her friend know, the news would be all over the school after all and it would be fun to see both Hermone and Harry's reactions. "Harry has been put down a year" Ginny informed her "he has to do all his first year classes again I was in McGonagall's office when she informed him. He'll be attending lessons with me from now on."

"Really' he is a first year again?"

"Yes, he is so inept with magic that he has to start from scratch. I probably know more than him and I've only just arrived. If he was any more unmagical he'd be a squib."

Hermione sighed. "I had such high hopes for him last year, after all he was the famous Harry Potter. It was an honour to befriend him."

"What honour?" Ginny shrugged "what exactly has he done since he arrived, what exactly has he done since he was born?"

"He defeated you-know-who when he was just a baby, everyone says so, as do all the books I have read abotu him."

"Did he? Nobody knew what happened back then and he was only a baby at the time."

"Harry told me something Dumbledore said, that it was because of his mother's love for him."

"So that's it. He never did a thing, his mother protected him even in death and Harry takes all the credit." Ginny made a retching sound. She hated people who took the glory for other people's actions. Their new D.A.D.A. professor was that sort too, and she didn't like him either.

"I guess if you put it that way" Hermione conceded "but what about what happened at school last year, all that business with the stone?"

"What of it? Ron told me what happened last year. Harry told you about the gringotts break in and other business, you pieced it all together. He was simply in the right place at the right time on a number of occasions. If it wasn't for you and Ron he would never have got through the chess game or the potions test, and in the mirror chamber it was his mother who saved him again. What did he do. A bit of work on a broom and caught a snitch, in this case a key. So what, he knows that I am better at that stuff than he is too. Again though, he takes credit for the actions of others."

Hermione could not deny Ginny's logic. For the first time she started to have doubts about her choice of Harry Potter as a friend. "You didsappoint me Harry" she adminished him "you really do. I used to value our friendship but now perhaps I should just leave you... under Ginny."

"It's for the best really, for his own good" Ginny approved "incidentally, next time you see Ron, feel free to let him know about Harry's true nature and tell him that I'll be taking care of him from now on. Encourage him to leave Harry to me."

"Gladly. I think Ron could do a lot better than Harry Potter."

Harry groaned, on top of everything else it appeared that he had now lost his two best friends. What else was there left for Ginny to take away from him?

"Well I guess I'll see you later" Hermione said then, with not even a cursory glance at Harry.

"One last thing" Ginny asked her friend "if you ever see Harry getting out of hand, or trying to be better than he is... feel free to restrain him until I arrive."

"Is there any form of restraint you have in mind."

"However you see fit. Hit him, knock him out, tie hip up, stun him, wthatever works. I heard about what you did to Neville last year, that sounds amusing."

"I didn't really want to do it to him you know, the body bind. It was effective though, and I don't think I'll have any trouble using it on Harry. I'll be hapy to in fact."

"Thanks."
122111212112.title: Hermione looks over and notices where Ginny is ...

choices: Snape agress, as long as he approves of Ginny's punishment methods
Ginny declines, deciding to leave Harry as he is and continues the lesson alone
1221112121121.content:
Shortly after Hermione left, Ginny finally lifted herself from her perch upon Harry's lap and stood next to him. "Get up Harry" she instructed him "our next lesson is double potions and we don't want to get in Snape's bad books. Well, I don't but I have heard that Snape has your name recorded in a black book all of your very own.

Harry sighed as he struggled to his feet, feeling quite unsteady as he rose. Ginny had been sitting on him for more than half an hour and as such his body had actually gotten used to bearing her weight. It would probably take a few minutes for the circulation and control to return to his legs. When Ginny noticed his lack of balance she couldn't help but giggle at what she had done to him.

Still, she instructed Harry to follow close behind her once more as she walked out of the Great Hall and made her way down to the dungeons for their next lesson. Harry must have looked like he was in a drunken fool as he staggered after her.

Why did it have to be Potions? He knew why, his timetable had changed. This morning it had shown that he did not have potions again until Friday, but now he was a first year once more with first year classes and that meant that this afternoon would be taken up with double potions.

Out of the corner of his eye, he could see Hermione and Ron heading up the main staircase to their next lesson, a class which he would have been taking too if McGonagall hadn't downgraded him. They didn't even give him a backward glance as they spoke together. From what Ginny had advised Hermione to tell Ron, he was fairly sure what the meaning of that conversation would be. He saw another chapter of his life disappearing before his eyes as the two of them faded out of sight.

Ginny and Harry descended the staircase that led to the dungeons and to the potions classroom, and Harry couldn't help but notice that the corridor was crowded with first year students. He didn't recognise any of them since he didn't hang around with first years all that much. Some of them gasped when they saw Harry, others gave inquiring looks whist a crowd of girls in Slytherin uniforms laughed out loud then started whispering amongst themselves, clearly speculating as to why Harry was here with them and coming up with all kinds of wild stories.

"Why have you brought an older boy down here Ginny?" a blonde girl in Ravenclaw robes asked her.

There was no harm in revealing the answer, knowing Snape he was bound to gloat about the act as soon as made his start-of-lesson speech, it was the nature of the man. [b]"Well you see, Luna" she responded "it is because Harry Potter here has been downgraded by his own head of house, I was in McGonagall's office when it happened. He is a first year again and he has been told to begin his magical education from scratch."

There was raucous laughter and jeering from the Slytherins at that point. Ginny had made no attempt to keep her voice quiet when she made her announcement so everybody had heard her.

Harry felt like the ground should open up and swallow him right there. Those slytherins looked like the kind of girls to mock him at every available opportunity.

Luna nodded mutely but she didn't deride him as the Slytherins had, not at that point anyway. She felt that if Harry Potter was as incompetent as he sounded, he needed to be moved down a year for his own good.

Snape opened the door the the Potions classroom and ushered everyone inside. As he glanced at Harry, a cruel smile played across his lips. "Ah yes, Potter" he smirked "Professor McGonagall told me you were to retake all your first year classes. I knoew from the start that you were an arrogant little upstart who wasn't cut out for magic, just like your father."

"Shut up about my father" Harry shouted at the man, raising the second-hand wand that Ginny had given him to replace his old one which she herself had now claimed."

"Tut tut not even your own wand I see, Potter" Snape droned on "I heard about what happened to it, oh right. Miss Weasley is aiming it at you."

Ginny wasn't trying to defend Harry, she had indeed raised her wand and pointed it at him but that was because she didn't want him to grow any sort of backbone by thinking he could challenge a professor. If he was inferior to her then surely the professors were way out of his league. Besides, if he cursed snape he was likely to cost Gryffindor House any number of points.

Snape's expression turned into a cold smile. [b]"I was thinking of taking 50 points from Gryffindor for that Potter, but I may be pursuaded otherwise." He glanced at Ginny. "Go ahead and show him what a wand can really do Miss Weasley" he encouraged her "and I may only take 10 points. If you use a really inspired curse and keep it on him for over ten minutes then I may forget about docking points completely.

Harry groaned. It seemed to him that Snape was likely to become Ginny's greatest ally in her battle for superiority over him. Not only was he likely to turn a blind eye to practically anything she would do to him, he was also apparently encouraging her. Snape's hatred of him had of course been legendary at this school, perhaps there was something about his fall from grace at her own hands which he found amusing.

Ginny seemed more than happy to oblige. She hadn't seriously considered cursing Harry at that point, she had raised her wand mrerely to warn him to lower his own but she wasn't about ignore a gift that was so generously given. Snape had not only given her the freedom to do whatevr she wanted, but if he approved of her actions she might prevent Harry from losing her house any points. All in all this was an opportunity not to be turned down. She only took a moment to decide on an appropriate spell.

She cast a bat-bogey hex on him, in as firm and direct a voice as she could muster.The force that came from her wand was immense and it hit Harry full in the chest. He doubled over instantly as cried out in pain as giant bat-sized objects dropped out of his nose and flew off down the corridor Ginny seemed particularly pleased with the effectiveness of her spell.

Snape was extatic, this first year girl was clearly already talented. Furthermore, he had seen her efforts in his lessons and he had so far found no fault with any of the potions that she had brewed. It wasn't like he favoured her, but he had no reason to single her out for disapproval like he had with Harry and some other students In fact, if she continued to apply herself to the task of keeping Harry in his place, then perhaps he might to value her like he did some of this Slytherin students. He did notice that a group of Slytherin grils had applauded when they saw what she did to Harry.

The class had by now taken their seats, incluiding Ginny who had left Harry where he was with the curse still firmly upon him. She wasn't about to remove it yer. After all, the ten minutes still weren't up.

Snape started going over today's lesson plan, explaining the details of the potion he wanted the students to brew. It wasn't until he had finished that he looked over at Ginny. "Those ten minutes are up" he informed her "no points shall be taken for Gryffindor house for this incident but if you relase Potter then I want him to be supervised by you for the remainder of the lesson."

"Does that mean I also get to punish him for any mistakes he makes, Professor" she asked then. It was pushing, she knew but if she was to take charge of the boy she wanted to be given the power to discipline him if need be too.

12211121211211.content:
"Fair enough, Miss Weasley" Snape concedes after considering her proposal for a few moments "as long as you can convince me that he really is being punished. I don't want any wish-washy excuses here or I'll end our agreement and put you both in detention."

"Don't worry Porfoessor, the kind of things I have in store for Harry are so degrading I wouldn't wish them on my worst enemy."

"In that case, we have an agreement, but like I say if you take that curse off him he will be your responsibility, it is your job to supervise him. You asign his tasks, and you monitor his work but you have no say over his hosue points since they would apply to you too. You can give him additional jobs though, or put him in detention which you will supervise. I will be monitoring you though."

"I understand Professor, thank you." Ginny gushed. This stuation couldn't have turned out any better. Snape had effectively given her the authority to do anything she wanted to do with Harry in his lesson, and nothing could have suited her purposes more.

She lifted the curse that she had put on him and called him over to where she was sitting. Knowing that Snape himself had given Ginny control over him, he didn't see any way to wriggle out of her request. Harry walked over and sat next to Harry. His nose still hurt like crazy, but no more bats were coming out of it.

She handed him the weakest knife she could find and pointed to a pile of green shoots that were on the table in front of him. "I want you to cut these shoots in to inch long pieces whilst I work on the rest of the potion she told him. I know you can't cope with anything more so that will be your sole task for now."

"I seem to remember this potion from last year" Harry commented as he started work on the shoots

"Yes and you couldn't do it then either" Snape informed him with a cursory glance in their direction.

"No, you are cutting them too short. No wonder you are so pathetic" Ginny admonished him, noting that many of them appeared to be far smaller than an inch. She took a sharper knife and cut into another of the roots, her offering was exactly the right size for the potion. "Use that one as a guide, it will show you what size I want the rest of them to be."

As Harry continued cutting on the shoots, Ginny measured out and applied the rest of the ingredients to her cauldron in the right measures, at the precisely given times and stirring her concoction precisely as instructed. No wonder she was so much better than Harry, she could follow instructions.

It took time for Harry to cut up those shoots, Ginny had purposefully given him the bluntest knife in her possession, so he had to use far more force to cut them up than would be needed if he had been given a sharper knife. The job was slow and laborious, and Harry was starting to get frustrated with it.

Eventually the monotony of the task became too much for him and he turned towards Ginny, fully intending to stab her with the knife in his hand. Ginny reacted in an instant though, she grabbed his wrist and twisted it firmly, causing him to cry out in pain and drop the knife. She then stepped on the object with her right foot and slapped Harry sharply across the face. "Detention, Harry!" she told him "
12211121211211.title: Snape agress, as long as he approves of Ginny...

choices: Potions is over and Ginny takes Harry back to the Great Hall for dinner
Snape suggests that Ginny might want to give Harry that detention
122111212112112.content:
Snape was curious to see what kind of detention Ginny might have in mind and he made a point to watch what she did with him, with look he might find the task amusing.

Ginny had by now almost competed her potion. "Have you got those shoots, Harry" she asked him "I need them now, ah yes." She took up a half dozen of the cutting that Harry had made with that knife and deposted them into her cauldron, leaving a large pile of them untouched. With a negligent swipe of her hand she knocked them off the table and into a nearby waste bin.

"I spent all lesson cutting those" Harry cried.

"Yes, I know but I only needed six of them. Didn't I tell you? All that work and you were too thick to know that I only needed half a dozen shoots, and you did this potion last year too. There is no wonder Professor McGonagall put you back a year, is there."

Snape was loving this, the way that Ginny kept putting him down. He couldn't do a better job if he tried. She was right too, she did only need a haf a dozen of those shoots.

The girl looked down at the last instruction. It told her to turn off the heat and leave the contents of the cauldron to stand for 25 minutes. She sighed as she extinguished the flame and set the timer on her cauldron. This was always the boring part of the job, the waiting game. "You don't mind if I read through my books whilst I wait on instruction 19 do you, Professor" she asked him.

"No that is fine, go ahead Miss Weasley" Snape replied.

Just then one of the other students, a fellow Gryffindor girl called over to her "Is it true that you sat on Harry's lap during your lunch break, Ginny?"

"Yes, it is true. I rather enjoyed it, to tell you the truth."

"I was at the staff table" Snape confirmed "I saw her sitting on Potter all the way through her lunch."

"Sit on him now" the other girl suggested "it'll mean you don't have to keep an eye on him whilst you are reading."

"That's true" Ginny smiled "Okay Harry, time to go back where you belong. Incidentally, if you make any move to try to stop me or to dislodge me then you will be serving more than one detention."

As she was already sitting next to him, Ginny smily lifted up slightly, edged across to where Harry was and sat back down. He made no move to try and stop her, he didn't dare. Ginny had already given him one detention, and he dreaded to think what she might do to him there. He didn't want to bring any more of them down upon him.

Ginny relaxed, and sat just as firmly upon Harry's lap as she had during their lunch break. Once she was in place she picked up her book and started to read through it.. Harry simply waited silently as he felt the now familiar presence of Ginny sitting on him. He considered the lesson so far, the time he had spent under the effects of a curse so powerful he couldn't image any 11 year old being able to pull it off to that extent, to the fact that he had cut up hundreds of those shoots when he only needed six. Why hadn't he considered that, was he really as worthless as Ginny suggested? Now she was sitting on him once more and some time in the near future he would serve his detention with her. Of all the Potions classes he had ever suffered through, this had to be the worst of them all.

Time seemed to pass exceptionally slowly for him, it seemed to take an eternity for that timer to count down the required 25 minutes and all that time Ginny remained seated upon him, her book held firmly in her hands whilst she ignored him and continued to read. Eventually though a bell informed her that the 25 minutes had passed and she signalled Snape to tell him that her potion was ready.

The professor took one look at the potion she had brewed and nodded his approval. Once more her work has as pefect as it always had been.

Ginny leads Harry to the library for a bit of catch-up reading
1221112121121121.content:
As the class ended, Harry had to admit that the fist impression his fellow first-years had of him ws one of utter defeat and humiliation. He was clearly not bright enough to brew even the simplest potions, even with constant supervision. No wonder he had been put down a year. Some wondered why Ginny was even bothering with him at all. It had been amusing watching her control him the way she did, although many suspected that had been more to do with Snape than anything she had done. Her command of that bat-bogey hex hand been masterful though.

"I'll let you know the date, time and location of Harry's detention, Professor" she told Snape at that point "I am sure you will find it particularly entertaining."

As the class started to file out, Ginny got up from his lap once more and led him towards the door. "Behind me, Harry. You know that by now" she instructed in a deceptively soft voice, and smiled as Harry walked behind her as she led him out of the dungeons and back towards the Great Hall. A couple of first years who had shared their class wondered if perhaps they had an arrangement that stretched beyond one single Potions lesson.

Ginny led Harry back in to the Great Hall and back towards the Gryffindor table. There were a number of people here already but there were plenty of spaces. It looked like Ron and Hermione hadn't arrived yet but then their class was a little further away.

"Now, Harry" Ginny informed him "you remember the procedure from lunch, I take it. Have a seat

"Must I?" Harry sighed, it seemed that Ginny had started taking every possibile opportunity to sit on him.

"Of course you must" she took out her wand and pointed it directly at him "Sit, Harry"

Casting a nervous glance at that wand and now feeling in no doubt as to the powert it represented. Harry took an empty space at the Gryffindor bench. Ginny then came forward and took her place once more, settling her butt cheeks into place upon his lap. Harry could feel her now familiar weight, her full weight upon him once more.

"Hands, Harry" she pointed out, taking his hands, in her own, passing them under the table and trapping them within the confines of her inner thighs once more. Harry was now once again trapped in the same position he had been in when Ginny was eating her lunch. Harry suspected that he was going to spend all of his meals in eactly this position, being used as Ginny's seat cushion. He had to admit that being sat upon by her was a lot more pleasant than some of the other things he had done to him lately,

"Get used to it Harry" Ginny informed him "you are going to be spending a lot of your meals in this position."

Ron and Hermione walked in to the Great Hall together at that point, but neither of them chose to sit next to Harry and Ginny this time. Hermione didn't even give Harry a second glance, and Ron didn't seem to either although he did smile at his sister as though he approved of what she was doing. It seemed clear to Harry that Hermione had been explaining things to him.

It wasn't long before a large quantity of assorted foodstuffs started to appear on the table and Ginny began to fill her plate. She also kept another plate aside for Harry but she didn't put anything on that yet, not until the best parts of the meal had already been picked at and she could offer him his selection of scraps.

At some point during Ginny's meal (not Harry's as he was in no position to tuck in to anything right now) there was a flapping of wings and the post owls started delivering letters to their eagerly waiting owners. A white Snowy Owl came close to where Ginny was sitting, a letter in her beak. She could sense that Harry was close but she couldn't see him anywhere. Then she noticed that Ginny wasn't sitting directly on the bench, she was sitting on.... and wasn't that his wand now in her own pocket?

The owl gave an undignified and derogatory squark and dropped the letter in front of Ginny. "Hello Hedwig" Harry greeted his owl "is that mine?"

Hedwig turned her back on him, refusing to even look at the boy she had called her owner. Instead she flew up and perched on Ginny's shoulder. When Harry reached up to try to pet her feathers though, the owl hooted and moved onto Ginny's shoulder, as though it had somehow made a decision as to with whom she truly belonged.

"I think you just lost your owl, Harry" she told him "maybe she doesn't like what she is seeing."

Harry was dumbfounded. Had this girl not only taken his broom, his wand and a year of his magical education. Had she now also taken ownership of his owl? What exactly did Harry have left to call his own?

"Hello Hedwig" Ginny smiled, patting her beak "are you my owl now?"

Hedwig gave a soft, welcoming hoot.

The girl looked down and the table and at the letter that Hedwig had dropped there. "Looks like mother's handwriting" she commented, taking the letter and opening it herself.

"That is mine" Harry complained.

"From now on Harry" Ginny informed him "any letters that are sent to you will be delviered to and read by me first. Did you catch that, Hedwig?"

Another soft hoot.

"Oh incidentally, if you see any other birds with letters addressed to Harry, I would be ever so grateful if you could intercept them and if Harry ever asks you to post any of his letters, I want you to rip them to shreds with your beak."

The bird acknowledged tihs request too.

Harry got the impression that Ginny would be writing to the Post Office and asking them to divert all his owls to her next. His owls indeed, now that Hedwig had betrated him he didn't have an owl any more.

Ginny had now opened and was reading Harry's letter. "Mother asks about your Harry" she informed him "she says she is missing you and asking if you have settled in to school again yet. She doesn't even mention our stolen car." She reached into her bag and took out a quill and parchment "I'll write back on your behalf Harry, isn't that nice of me? I'll tell her all about how useless you are without me, how you always takes credit for other people's actions and I'll even mention the fact that you tried to attack me with my own knife, but that I was able to defend myself easily. I've asked Mom to let you stay at the Burrow during the summer under my supervision. I can't have you leaving my sight, even for a couple months. Besides you've always wanted to move out of the Dursleys', so it works good for you too" said Ginny in a deceptively sweet voice. She soon finished writing her letter, then she addressed it to her mother and passed it to Hedwig. The bird flew off, back the way it had come. Now it seemed that Ginny had alienated him from the rest of her family, including the woman who had seen him as an extension of her own family, Mrs Weasley. Even though he'd still see them at the Burrow in the summers, it would be a completely different greeting than the one he had this past summer.

Once Ginny finished her meal, she once more loaded Harry's plate with scraps from the table and waited for dessert. She even freed his hands so he could eat his main course now but she still continued to sit upon him. Once Harry had finished eating though, she put his hands back in their fleshy prision between her thighs.

The same happened with dessert. Ginny had hers first then she took a portion of the least appetising option available and passsed it to Harry. It was only when they had both finished both courses that Ginny finally got up and led him away from the Great Hall.
1221112121121121.title: Potions is over and Ginny takes Harry back to t...

Ginny takes a mysterious diary out of her bag
12211121211211211.content:
Ginny led Harry back up the main staircase and then onwards towards Gryffindor tower, all the time instructing him to stay clsoe behind her as was his rightful position when they travelled. Harry was used to seeing the red haired girl in front of him when he walked, and his posiition and the status it implied had not gone unnoticed by some of the other students, there were twitters and giggles from many of the other students that they passed.

In time they came to the portrait of the Fat Lady, who as usual requested the password to the Gryffindor Common Room. The portrait woman's eyes showed clear sings of sympathy when she looked at Harry though. Gossip as it tended to do, had proceeded them and the news that Harry had been demoted to a First Year was now common knowledge. Even the paintings were aware of it.

"Don't waste your sympathy on him" Ginny admonished "he is such an incompetent loon he deserved everything he got. In fact I consider him to be so unreliable that I don't think he should be allowed to wander the corridors unaccompanied. If it was in my power I'd instruct you not to let him out of the common room unless he is in my company. For his own protection of course," She gave an encouraging litle smile. She didn't for one moment suspect that the Fat Lady might actually consider this, but of course if she did it would further enhance her hold upon Harry.

"Well..." the Fat Lady pondered "if Harry here is as incompetent as you suggest, and of course he has been reconstituted a First Year... I'll consult with one of the portraits in Professor McGonagall's study. It is your Head of House who has the authority to make such a decision."

Ginny was both shocked and delighted, the Fat Lady was really going to look into her proposal. Ginny had already convinced the professor to keep Harry down a year, perhaps it wouldn't take much convincing to include this additional clause.

"Thank you" she smiled, giving the Fat Lady a respectful curtsey as she led Harry into the room which he may soon may never be able to leave of his own accord.

The room was not completely deserted. Hermione Granger sat a short distance away. She greeted Ginny as she entered. "I heard what you were saying to the Fat Lady just now" she commented "do you think McGonagall will agree to your proposal?"

"She might, considering she already agreed to put Harry down a year. Take a seat Harry."

Harry dutifully wandered over to one of the empty chairs and sat down. He wondered if he was really about to become a prisoner of the Gryffindor Common Room as Ginny had implied.

"I've been doing a bit of reading, if you can imagine that" Hermione commented, holding up her copy of 'Hogwarts: A History' which by now was showing signs of being particularly well read "and did you know that in the entire history of Hogwarts, not student has ever been forced to repeat a year... well, until Harry here of course."

""Imagine that" Ginny chuckled, claiming her seat which incidentally was the one that Harry was also occupying. "did you har that Harry? You made the history books again, but this time for all the right reasons. How you ever got in to Hogwarts is probably the biggest mystery of all time."

Harry felt the ever-familiar presece of Ginny sitting on him, and of course it came as no surprise to him. This girl seemed to be sitting on his lap at every opportunity and by now the act seemed so commonplace that he started to wonder if that was the real reason that he had been accepted at this school, simply to serve as an object for this girl to sit upon. Hermione noticed that Ginny looked perfectly relaxed and content, as though she wasn't even aware that Harry was under her.
12211121211211211.title: Ginny takes Harry back to the Gryffindor common...

choices: They find an interesting way to trap Harry in the common room
122111212112112112.content:
Now that she was comfortably seated upon Harry, Ginny reached into her bag and took out a small unmarked book. Hermione by this time had gone back to browsing through Hogwarts: A History. Pondering the meaning of the book for a moment, she started leafing through the pages but for some reason found them to be completely blank. She took out her wand and tried a few spells she had learned that should enable her to see invisible or concealed writing but none of them seemed to be effective.

"Harry" she addressed him "I want you to keep perfectly still and don't disturb me whilst I work on the myster of this book. I spotted it among my school books the other day but I can't work out exactly what it does."

Harry was only too happy to remain quiet. Whilst Ginny's mind was on other things he could be free to examine his own thoughts, it was true that Ginny was still sitting on him but other than that it occured to him that she might leave him alone for a few moments. Harry approved of that.

Presently she took up quill and ink, found a blank page in one of the books and wrote a single word "hello"
"Some more text started to appear below it "Hello, who are you?"
"Ginny"
"Hello Ginny, My name is Tom Riddle"

For a moment, Ginny was intrigued, the owner of this book had put his own awareness into it somehow, she could even talk to him, but she didn't know this boy. Who was he?"

"What is this book?" she wrote then.
"It is my diary, in it I stored some of my most treasured memories Would you like to see?"
She paused for a moment then wrote a single word... "Yes."

Ginny suddently felt a strange sensation, as though she was being pulled into the book although it didn't actually feel like she was moving at all.

Then she appeared not to be in the Gryffindor common room at all, she was in the great hall and she could see a line of students at the front of the hall, and before them a stool and a hat. It was the sorting ceremony. One of the professors called the name "Ridde, Tom" and a boy came forward and took a sat on the stool. The professor laid the hat on his head and a moment later the hat cried out "Slytherin!". There were cheers from the Slytherin table as Tom Riddle took his seat.

The scene changed, they were still in the Great Hall but a few years later. Tom Riddle was sat somewhere among the crowd of students at the Slytherin table, he had a badge on the front of his robes sporting a single letter 'P'. The meal was over and the headmaster had stood up. "Now that the meal is over, everyone please make their way to their way to their dormitories. Prefects, if you would be so kind as to escort the First Year students."

Riddle stood up and chanted in a rather sing-song voice "Fist years, follow me please." Along with a female student who was perhaps a year or so older he led the group of first year students out of the Great Hall and down towards the dungeons where the Slytherin Commom Room was located. Ginny got the impression that this was the first time Tom Riddle had done this job. For some reason he didn't yet look comfortable in the role.

She was shown a couple more scenes of Tom's life at Hogwarts, then the images disappeared and she once more was was once more sat on Harry in the Gryffindor Common Room. "That was weird" she uttered "I seemed to be travelling all over the place."

"You never left your seat, Ginny" Hermione informed her.

"But it was all so real."

"This is real, Ginny, this place.. you, me, even Harry whom you have been sitting on the entire time."

Ginny nodded, of course Harry was real, he could feel him beneath her. Even though he was currenlty no more than the lining of her chair. He felt perfectly real to her. Those visions were precisely that, they were just visions. They had no substance, and what of that boy, that boy who was not Harry? Whilst she was with him she didn't think about Harry at all, not one bit. That wouldn't do at all, she liked thinking about Harry, she liked finding new and entertaining ways to degrade and humiliate him.

"I don't want this diary" she stated at least "and I definitely don't trust Tom Riddle. I think he wants to lead me astray."

"Who is Tom Riddle."

"TThe owner of this diary, he is the one who I kept seeing in those visions."

"That sounds ominous."

"It does indeed, you know what? I am going to take this thing to Professor Dumbledore."

"Good idea!"

1221112121121121122.content:
"I'm going to head to Professor Dumbledore's office...alone" said Ginny. "Harry, you are not to leave from that spot until I return, got that? If Professor McGonagall agrees to keep you confined here when not in my presence, I don't want to mess up by having you wander the school without me."

"What am I supposed to do in the meantime from this spot?" asked Harry.

"I know! Hermione, you wanted to try out Harry as a seat cushion, right? Now's the opportunity. Keep him in his place, okay?"

"Sure thing, Ginny. Take as much time as you need because I know once you get back, Harry's yours again, right?"

"That's true", giggled Ginny. "I'l try to stall getting back so you can have this time with Harry."

Ginny then got up which Harry immediately missed the feel of Ginny on him. Hermione then stood up from her seat and sat on Harry.

"Have fun you two" laughed Ginny as she left Hermione to continue reading while Harry was still being used as a seat cushion. She would have to make a reminder that whenever she had Quidditch practice (which would be a lot when Wood started the practices), she would ask Hermione to watch Harry in her place. She then took as much time as she could making it to Professor Dumbledore's office, for Hermione's benefit of course, but she finally came upon the entrance to Professor Dumbledore's office.

She knew of Dumbledore's love of candy so she rattled off different candies until she said "Chocoalte Frogs" and the gargoyle moved. When she reached the door, she knocked. After a moment she heard Professor Dumbledore tell her to come in.

12211121211211211222.content:
Ginny opened the door and made her way into Dumbledore's office. It seemed though that the headmaster wasn't alone.

"Ah, Miss Weasley" McGonagall greated her "One of my portaits has advised me that you have asked the Fat Lady not to let Potter out of the common room when you are not accompanying him. Why?"

"Well, Professor" Ginny began, thinking fast on her feet "I noticed that after during Potions class, people were jeering at and tormenting Harry about the fact that he has been put down a year. I don't think it will be long before some people would use this as an excuse to consider more direct forms of bullying, threats of violence perhaps or even firing curses at him. Frankly, Professor I don't think Harry is in any position to defend himself, not even from a first year so I think it best if he were only allowed out of the common room when I am in a position to attend to him, for his owl sake.

Ginny didn't mention what form that attention, might take, nor that she was the 'first year' she had in mind that Harry would be unable to defend himself against. She had worded her request in terms that suggested that she was caring about Harry's welfare, appealing to the Professor's natural protective instinct.

It worked!

"Very well Miss Weasley" Professor McGonagall conceded "when you put it like that, yes I see you have a point. Very well, I shall instruct the Fat Lady not to let Harry out of the common room under any circumstances, except under your direct supervision.

"Thank you, Professor" Ginny responded meekly, although internally she gloated. She had just succeeded in putting yet another restriction on the great Harry Potter.

"Now that is settled" Dumbledore began "what was it you wanted to see me about. Did you just want to discuss this matter regading Harry Potter or was there something else on your mind?"

"It was this book, Professor" Ginny explained "I found it buried in the school books that I had bought from Flourish and Blotts this year. I don't know how it got there, and I was curious about it. It appeared blank, so I tried what spells I could to make the writing visible. None of them worked."

"Hmmm"

"Well, eventually I found a blank page and started writing in it, and this must seem odd. It wrote back to me. I had the strangest conversation with a book of all things, it even identified itself by name. It said it was the diary of someone called Tom Riddle."

"Riddle!" Dumbledore came to attention immediately at the sound of the name.

"Yes sir" Well soon it started to show me these visions, like pictures, our kind of pictures, the ones that move only I found I was somehow in the picture watching events unfold. I saw this Riddle person being sorted into Slytherin, and later being a prefect, and a few other incidents besides then I was suddenly back where I was in the common room. It was so strange sir, and to be honest I didn't really like it."

"I'd say you were right to bring this book to me, Miss Weasley" Dumbledore nodded "May I have it? Why don't you sit down and I'll tell you a story."

Ginny handed the book over and took an empty seat at Dumbledore's table. She was happy to stay a while, as that gave Hermione more time with Harry back in the common room, so she could use him as her personal seat cushion.

"Some time ago" Dumbledore informed her "before I was Headmaster, when the school was run by Professor Dippet and I was merely the Transfiguration Professor.... a boy came to this school, a boy I had visted personally at a muggle orphanage, a boy called Tom Marvolo Riddle."

The story didn't seem so bad so far, so this was the boy who owned the diary was it.

"Riddle was a keen and attentive student" Dumbledore went on "and yes, his growing skilsl and attentiveness to his studies led me to choose him as Prefect for Slytherin Hosue in his fifth year. Little did I know what kind of man Riddle would later become.

Dumbledore took a spare piece of parchment and wrote Riddles name upon it, then he waved his wand and the letters reordered themselves to read 'I AM LORD VOLDEMORT' and Ginny gave a gasp of surprise.

"This belonged to.... You Know Who?"

"Yes, it was one of Voldemort's possessions. You say you found it among your new school books. Did anything unusual happen whilst you were in Flourish and Blotts?" Dumbledore didn't for a second asume Ginny was responsible for any of this, after all she had brought the book to him of her own free will.

"It was a busy day of shopping" she mused "Mother and Father had taken us to Diagon Alley to get our new school supplies, Harry was with us too. Professor Lockhart was there signing copies of his new book. He spotted Harry and gave him signed copies of all his own books for free. The Malfoys were there too, they were accusing Harry of seeking fame and drawing too much attention to himself. They weren't very pleasant about it."

"I see" Dumbledore mused "well I'll talk to Professor Lockhart of course, get his account of what happened that day. One thing you can be sure of though, you needn't worry about this book any more?"

"Thank you Professor. If I may ask, how come you are able to say You Know Who's name so freely?"

"It is just a name, Miss Weasley like any other. It may interest you to know that Harry also uses his real name."

"Harry calls him.. Vol... Voldemort." Ginny spoke that name as though for the first time, she felt sure she shouldn't but if Harry could use it, so could she. After all, there was nothing that boy could do that she couldn't do beter. She made a mental note to call Voldemort by his real name from now on."

"Indeed" Dumbledore nodded "now about that book, let's get rid of it shall we?"

He raised his wand and for a time ottered a couple of spells that seemed to have no visible effect, then he pointed at the book and a firece jet of flame shot out of it and consumed the diary. The article appeared to emit a terrifying scream is it was reduced to a pile of ashes on Dumbledore's desk.

"That was a highly controlled version of a spell called Fiendfyre" Dumbledore informed her "a very dangerous spell when not handled correctly. It feeds on anything it touches. I can assure you that the book has been destroyed. Dumbledore got the impression though that more than a mere book had died that day.

"Incidentally, Miss Weasley" Dumbledore informed her "by means of gratitude for your prompt and well considered actions, you will of couse be given a Special Award for Services to Hogwarts School, a very rare trophy indeed."

"Thank you, sir"

"and I hereby award Gryffindor House a hundred points, and you are welcome to a Sherbet Lemon on your way out."

Ginny recognised the dismissal, but she was pleased to have come and to have aided in the destruction of what was clearly a dangerous magical object. Even though she was still just starting her magical education it seemed she had done far more to assist the magical community than Harry, even though he had, as she had pointed out, taken the credit for other people's actions. She thanked both Professors for them time and generosity, and taking one of the strange looking sweets she made her way out of the headmaster's office and back down the spiral staircase.

122111212112112112221.content:
Even though the conversation with the Headmaster and her Head of House had taken several minutes, Ginny felt no real desire to return to the common room just yer. She knew that Harry would still be there and that Hermione would continue to sit on him until she got back. If her friend was happy to use Harry as her seat cushion then perhaps Ginny might also pursuade her to think of Harry in the same way she did, The thought of Hermione as an ally and willing participant in her agenda for the so-called-famous Harry Potter was a particularly welcome one She also knew that Herminone was someone who could sit and study for hours on end if she so desired. There really wasn't any point in disturbing her just yet.

At as casual pace as she could manage she made her way down to the Great Hall where supplies of Pumpkin Juice were still available for any students who might suddenly feel thirsty, she took one and headed to the Gryffindor table to sup it as slowly as she could Something felt wrong as she sat down though, Harry wasn't under her this time and it felt wrong somehow not to feel his presence down there. She pushed that thought to one corner of her mind though as she recalled that in the Gryffindor Common Room right now, Hermione would still be sitting on him. She allowed that thought to wash over her as she took her time drinking her pumpkin juice.

Eventually though, the cup was emptied, and feeling a sudden need Ginny made her way to the Girls' Toilets to attend to it. She soon found an empty cubicle and after taking care of herself she waited a while, still perched upon the seat until some girls outside started asking her if she was alright. She smiled and told them she was fine, but feeling she couldn't wait much longer withotu arousing suspicion, she flushed, washed her hands and left to find some other means of occupying her time.

She visted the owlery but then she remembered that Hedwig was still delivering her letter, so she left. She told herself that she should take Harry's stash of Owl Treats sometime soon though, since he wasn't going to be needing them any more.

Wondering if there was something else she could do to ensure that Harry continued to serve as the lining of Hermione's chair for a while, she went down to the library to see if there were any interesting books she could borrow. She perused the shelves for a while, quickly finding a couple of titles that interested her but feeling in no real rush to take them. Instead she looked over some other shelves that contained books that didn't interest her at all, but she still took time to read over the titles as though she was really considering borrowing them. It was amazing how long you could draw out this particular activity. The librarian even came over and asked her if she needed any help at one point. Finally though, like everything else she decided that there was only so much time she could waste she went back to her original choice, and a couple of other books that had taken her eye and carried them over to the counter. She was served far too soon for her own liking, but now running out of ideas for ways to delay her return, she decided to head back to Gryffindor Tower, it was by this time about an hour and a half since she had left.

During all this time, Hermione had not moved from her seat in the Hogwarts Common Room, she still continued to sit upon Harry just as she had been doing when Ginny had departed and her full weight centred upon him, pressing him firmly and deliberately into the chair itself. Being a year older, Hermione weighed slightly more than Ginny and Harry was acutely aware of this difference. Hermione continued to sit and Harry continued to be sat upon by her. Even though had quickly picked up her book and had started to read, she never lost track of Harry''s position beneath her. She sat with her book and seemed to pay him no attention, but Harry could not ignore the fact that she was there.

Harry of course knew Hermione and that she was described, quite accurately as the smartest witch of her age. There were things that girl would do with her wand that Harry couldn't even dream of, if it came to any kind of contest of brooms Harry would be effectively naked in front of her. He also knew that Hermione loved to read and hated to be disturbed. Taking all that into account he had no intention of disturbing her at all and simply accept her presence upon him.

Thus their situation continued for an hour and a half, Hermione simply sitting and reading, and Harry being sat upon. Hermione clearly had no intention of changing that fact, at least until Ginny returned. She was even enjoying the feeling of using Harry as part of her seat. Even though Ron had also been with him at the time, she wondered what it might have been like if she had sat on him the first time they met, on the train last year, travelling to Hogwarts for the first time. What if, instead of repairing his glasses and leaving she had walked over to Harry and purposefully sat on him. That thought amused her for some reason.

In time though Hermione put those thoughts aside as the portrait door swung open. Was Ginny finally back? She had been gone a long while, but of course Hermione knew that a lot of that would have been for her benefit. She was grateful. Then she heard the voice of the Fat Lady herself.

"Oh, Miss Weasley" The Fat Lady informed her "it may interest you to know that I have received confirmation from Professor McGonagall herself regarding your request for Mister Harry Potter. He will not be permitted to leave this room unless you are with him, and even if he is with you, then you need only give the word and I will not let him pass."

"Can you make that one word from me or Miss Hermione Granger?" Ginny countered, feeling that her friend should be offered additional say in such matters "although it is me still that must accompany him."

"Very well. You must accompany him outside, but either of you may shut the door in his face if that is what you wish."

"It is, thanks. Hello Hermione." Ginny came into the room and noticed that her friend was still stiting on Harry, the same as she had been when she left the room. "Has he behaved?" she asked.

"He has been the perfect little seat cushion" Hermione giggled "he still is in fact, it is a pleasure to sit on him."

"It is, isn't it?"

"Any time you want me to take over" Hermione informed her "any time at all, just let me know and I'll happily resume my seat. I can sit on him for hours if need be."

"Thanks Hermione, I appreciate that."

"But I guess you want him back now?" she invited.
