1221112121121121122212.content:
Ginny looked over at Hermione, who was still seated upon Harry's lap. The girl seemed perfectly content there, and Ginny wasn't a selfish girl at all. Was there any reason to move her?

"Why don't you keep him where he is for now?" Ginny responded "that is if you don't mind sitting on him."

"I'll be happy to" Hermione smiled as she relaxed, pefectly content to leave him exactly where he was.

Ginny took a separate seat, one that was an angle to the one Hermione occupied, so she could watch and enjoy the sight of Hermione sitting on The Boy Who Lived. Like herself, Hermione was wearing a small skirt beneath her robes, and her legs were close together. From the side it was clear that Harry was under there somewhere, She sat back, moulding her entire body to his and pressing herself firmly into him. Her knees and her thighs also matched the fold of Harry's legs and her feet were not touching the floor. It was a pleasant sight to behold.

"I can see why you like sitting on him" Hermione giggled "he does seem well suited to the position."

"It is about all he is good for" Ginny retorted, she told Hermione about Harry's Potions lesson.

"He doesn't know you only need six shoots?" Hermione laughed "he's even stupider than I thought. He deserved to start over in first year."

"Indeed, and I must say I've never had more fun in a potions lesson, Snape was wonderful. He effectively gave me free reign to do whatever I wanted with Harry. He even encouraged me to hex Harry here for no more than ten minutes in order to prevent Gryffindor house from losing any points due to his incompetence. I jumped at the chance and cast the strongest 'Bat Bogey Hex' I have ever achieved.

"That spell is one of your specialities, isn't it?"

"It is one I am particularly proud of, yes."

Hermione giggled, but she didn't laugh so much at Ginny's next admision.

"Can you believe that at one point Harry actually tried to stab me with my own knife?"

"He did WHAT? Hermione was aghast, She even lifted her knees sightly and leaned back, applying even more pressure to the boy she was sitting on, then she leaned forward slightly and slapped him sharply across the face.

Ginny approved, but continued her recital "well anyway, by now Snape was so impressed with me he had actually given me the right to discpline Harry in his lessons, so I gave him detention.

"Good, has he served it yet?"

"Not yet, I was considering alternatives, but every time I settle on something I seem to think of something else, even worse."

"I am sure you can consider something suitably gross and degrading, you seem to have a talent for it as far as Harry is concerned."

"I'm sure of it."

"Oh, what happened about that book by the way, the one you took to Dumbledore's office?"

"Well apparently I was right to take it to him, it contained some horrible evil magic. Dumbledore didn't go in to details but he did tell me that Tom Riddle was Voldemort's name at one time, and the diary belonged to him apparently."

"You don't have any problem saying his name then?"

"Ginny shrugged "I'll probably offend both my parents but to be honest, if Harry here can say the name then I sure as heck can too."

"Yes, but apparently Harry is too stupid to know what it means."

"Dumbledore says his name too, and he is far smarter than Harry."

"You have a point there. So what happened to the book?"

"Dumbledore destroyed it, with some kind of magical fire that he said was very dangerous if not controlled, but he controlled it well enough. It burned the book down to ashes in no time but nothing else was harmed. There was even a wailing sound coming from the book at that point, as though something terrible was dying."

"So that is that, no more Tom Riddle, no more strange magical books, it is just us and Harry."

"I'd say. Oh Dumbledore gave me what he said was a Special Award for Services to the School and awarded a hundred points to Gryffindor points. It seemed that giving that book to Dumbledore was definitely the right thing to do."

"I wonder if Harry has ever won anything for any of these acts he was supposedly responsible for?"

"Nope, not a thing. It seems I am far more deserving of recognition than that wastrel you are sitting on."

"And rightly so too."

"One other thing, you remembered me suggesting to the Fat Lady that Harry should not be allowed out unless accompanied by me?"

"Yes."

"Apparently she got in touch with McGonagall who was also in Dumbledore's office when I went up there. I managed to convince her that Harry is not safe to be allowed to wander the school on his own, that he might be subject to ridicule and bullying so he would need someone to watch out for him, namely me."

"A curious way to put it, you know which girls he most needs protection from."

"Indeed, but anyway McGonagall bought it and Dumbledore made no objection. When I got back I heard the Fat Lady confirming that Harry is now confined to the common room, unless I am acompanying him he can not leave."

"Perfect!"

"I thought you'd like it, incidentally it seems that both you and I can at any time tell the Fat Lady to slam the door in his face."

"Yes, I caught a bit of that as you arrived."

The two girls chatted together about various, incidental things then Ginny suddly started to yawn, and Hermione followed soon after.

"I say we start thinking about going to bed" Ginny suggested "too bad Harry has to sleep in the boys' dorms though, but at least we can visit him there if we want."

"I was just thinking the ame" Hermione agreed "though he can't leave the common room anyway, so there is no way he can sneak away in the morning."

"That's true, at least."

12211121211211211222122.content:
Just then there is a sound of the Common Room entrance opening once more and the fat lady is heard to say "Hello Professor."

Instantly, Hermione vacats her position of sitting on Harry and takes an empty seat nearby

"Hello Miss Weasley, Miss Granger" Professor McGongall greets them just then "I just wanted to come in and remind you that Potter will be moving to the First Years' dorm now, as that is his present designation, but I would suggest three of you to seek you beds anyway, it is getting late."

"We were just talking about going to bed, professor" Hermione agreed, relieved that McGonagall didn't seem to have noticed where she had been sitting just a few moments before.

"About that Professor" Ginny started, sensing another opportunity "you agree with me that Harry should stay with me for his own protection, I believe that is why you agreed to him being confined in this common room when I am not here to supervise him."

"Yes, that is right Miss Weasley."

"Well, I can't very well keep an eye on him if he is not in the same dorm now, can I?"

"We do have separate sleeping quarters for boys and for girls, if you want to keep an eye on him you can visit him in the boys' dorm now and then, there is no restriction on that, only the other way around as I am sure you know."

"Yes, well I was wondering if an exception might be made in Harry's case."

"You want him to be able to visit you in the girls' dormitory?"

"Not quite, I was wondering if he could move in to my dorm, that way he really can be in my care at all times."

"That would mean cancelling the spell, I don't think that would be a very good idea."

"Not cancelled precicely, just reversed... and only in his case. That way he can sleep in the girls dorms but he won't be permitted to visit the boys in theirs."

McGanagall thought about it "It's a little unauthodox" she mused "but it is not beyond the realms of possibility and you do make a very convincing case. Very well Miss Weasley, Potter will move in with you, I believe there is a spare bed in your dorm? The one next to your own in fact."

"Thank you, Professor"

McGonagall pointed her wand at the staircase at the entrance to the dorms and made a few silent adjustments to the protective spell. "It is done" she announced "now please get to bed, all three of you."

As McGonagall left, Harry suddenly groaned. "My trunk is in the boys' dorm" he advised "and all my clothes too, what am I going to do now?"

"You can worry about that in the morning, Ginny giggled. Right now, you need to go to bed."

The two of them together led Harry up the stairs and down the corridor that led to the girls' dorms. Harry did notice that the barrier that normally would have prevented him coming this way made no do so on this occasion and he passed safely through it.

Soon they came to a door with a sign above it reading "First Year Girls", and they both stopped in front of it.

"Get in, Harry" Ginny laughed at him "this will be your room now too."

Trembling, Harry reached towards the handle and slowly opened the door.

"What will we do about Harry's trunk and his clothes?" Herminoe offered then.

Ginny laughed even harder.

122111212112112112221222.content:
As Harry opened the door to the first year girls' dorm, he notices that Ginny and Hermione's voices are joined by others too, apparently not everybody is asleep.

"I'm not going in there, where a load of younger girls can gawk at me" he stammered.

"Get in!" Hermione ordered and gave him a forceful shove that knocked him through the door and flat on to the ground.

"What is a boy doing here?" One of the girls suddenly asked of the two by the door, not immediately regonising him. He was face down in fromt of them after all, and there wasn't a great deal of light.

"This is Harry Potter" Ginny informed her, you remember him don't you Sophie?"

The boy who was forced to restart his first year?" Sophie replied "yes I remember, he was in our Potions class but he is still a boy and this is a girls' dorm."

"She has also been reclassified as a girl" Hermione pointed out.

"What do you mean?"

"Well the barrier just let her through?"

"You mean the barrier that doesn't let boys anywhere near our dorms?" another girl asked.

"That's right."

"Imagine that, Emily" Sophie mused "if the barrier has told her that she is a girl then a girl she must be."

"What is more amusing" Ginny giggled "is that that same barrier works the other way for her, it won't let her into the boys' sleeping quarters any more so that means she'll have to stay here with us."

"Okay then, girl" Sophie was really warming to the news now "I guess that will be your bed from now on. You might as well make use of it." She pointed to the empty bed next to Ginny's.

"You heard her" Ginny told him "get undressed and get in to bed."

"In front of all these girls, I'd rather not."

"You are officially a girl now Harry" Ginny reminded him "these are girls too, you have nothing to hide from them so strip down to your underwear and get in to bed." She then remembered just what underwear Harry was wearing and she started to chuckle at the thought.

"I refuse!"

"Girls" Ginny suggested carmly "this girl is feeling a little shy, why dont' we all help her to get undressed and in to bed. Hermione, don't let her leave."

Hermione dutifully stood in the doorway, blocking the only possible exit from the room. She loved the way that all the first years had started referring to Harry as a girl, she would of course remember to address her in the same manner now and then.

Harry tried running for the door, but Hermione pushed him back, for a time he ran around the room in an effort to evade the girls who were now chasing after him, giggling like mad and loving the little game that Ginny had suggested. It didn't take long for them to overpower him, and when they did they dragged him back to the bed which was now to be his and with Ginny also joining the group, they forced him down onto it. A couple of them then straddled him and started removing Harry's clothes. His robe was the first to come off, then his shoes and his socks. At that point they started stipping his top and his shirt.

Having stipped him of all but his trousers, the girls shifted their positions, those sitting on his legs then moved to his chest and upper body whilst they relieved him of those too. At that point there was a collective gasp of surprise. Harry was wearing a girls' underclothes.

"Those are yours aren't they Ginny?" Emily pointed out, pointing to the one article of clothing that Harry was still wearing.

"They were mine, now they are Harry's" Ginny pointed out "she's been wearing them all day, after I burned her old ones. She doesn't need them any more now anyway, she is a girl after all and as such she needs to wear girls' underwear, as is good and proper. Considering her new sleeping arrangements, there is no way she will be able to reach her old clothes anyhow."

A group of girls laughed at this, then went to their own drawers and started to take out old pairs of undergarments that they had outgrown or didn't care for any more. As a group, they then threw them in Harry's direction. "Now you have a complete set" Ginny laughed as she colelcted them and stored them neatly in one of Harry's empty drawers."

"What about the rest of my clothes?" Harry whined.

"We'll think about that later, for now I think you shoud just get in to bed. It is entirely possible though that from tomorrow you'll have to walk around Hogwarts dressed as the girl that you are."

Harry groaned at the thought of that, but feeling tired he slipped into the bed that would now be his own, and before long he fell asleep.

1221112121121121122212221.content:
Harry awoke the next day in a strange seeming room, the place seemed to be full of frilly pillows and bits of lace, there were flowers on msot of the tables and the ceiling seemed to contain a pinkish, flowery design. He also noticed that his sheets wre pulles strangely tight as there were a number of girls sitting on his bed, some of them so close that he could actually feel them against him. He recognised that one of the girls had red hair, that was obviously Ginny and he seemeed to remember a couple of the others from somewhere. He also saw that most of the girls were still wearing their nighties.

"What are you girls doing in a boys' dorm?" He asked them suddenly "get out of here at once. Where's Ron?" Apparently, in his half-asleep state he had forgotten some of the more significant events of yesterday, including two important changes of identification.

"Assuming Ron is still asleep he is where he aught to be, in the second year boys' dorm with the rest of the second year boys."

"Why aren't I there with him?"

"Don't you recall?" The girl called Sophie asked him, she was sitting next to Ginny, not far from his chest "you aren't a second year any more Harry, you are a first year like us."

"You are also a Girl, like the rest of us according to the barrier on the staircase" another girl, Emily informed him "so this is your dorm and your bed now Harry. She then thought a moment "That doesn't seem quite right though. Whoever heard of a girl called Harry before?"

"Short for Hariet?" Ginny suggested "that is a perfectly acceptable girl's name."

"Does she have a middle initial?"

"J"

"Hariet Jane Potter, yes it has a nice ring to it that."

"I was named James after my father" Harry sputtered.

"You would have been named for your father if you were a boy, but instead you were a girl named Hariet Jane, that is your true name, that is what I think we should call you from now on, at least whilst you are in our dorm."

"This can't be happening to me" Harry moaned, then some of the events of yesterday came flooding back to him and he let out a long groan."

"Do you mind giving me some space so I can get dressed." he demanded of them

"We'll do no such thing" Sophie flared "you are a girl too, one of us now, so there is no reason to show the same modesty that we do around boys. I guess you'll have to wear the same clothes you had on yesterday as you don't have any alternatives now but I would advise some clean undewear, I believe there are a few choices in the droor by your bed."

"Hold of on that for a time, Hariet" Ginny advised him "I want to go get cleaned up first. Girls, would you please keep Hariet under his covers until I get back."

"How do you propose we do that?" Emily offered "hold him down?"

"Well yes, in a way. I'm sure you remember Hermione who brought Hariet her in with me yesterday" Ginny was amused by the way they were playing with his name "did you know she kept Hariet here trapped in the common room for over an hour yesterday when I went out of the common room, by sitting on her."

"I wish I'd seen that"Sophie giggled "and I suppose we could, I mean I am practically sitting on her already." Harry realised that this was the girl that was sitting so close to him that he could feel her presence. She scooted backwards upon his bed until she was sitting directly upon his chest "Come on Emily" she giggled.

Ginny had completed her first Quidditch practice sesion and returned to the common room, hoping to see Harry there under the control of one or more of the girls. She was surprised to find that the First Years' dorm was apparently deserted.

"Hariet, Hariet are you up here?" she called, walking up and down the corridor.

"Hello Hermione, where's Hariet. Oh of course, you are both sitting on her. You don't mind if I join you."

"But I sat on his face for a while" Sophie declared "smothered him out too, then let him wake up so I could do it again. That was fun,"

"Quidditch was awesome" Ginny exlaimed "it really is the best game in the world, too complicated for the likes of Hariet though which is clearly why he was booted from the team."

"You had a good session?" Sophe inquired

He thought Hariet was simply filling the position until a real seeker came along to replace her. He was so disappointed in Hariet and so delighted with me that he even asked Madam Hooch to ban her from the quidditch pitch completely, including the stands so he won't be allowed to even watch a game."

"She said she would want to consult with McGonagall about it, but at one point our Head of House made an appearance in the stands so she could watch the first training session of the year. She even thanked me for taking over from Hariet, she said she had never been so disappointed with a seeker until she saw her in action and that she even regretted appointing her in the first place. She said that after that first Flying lesson when Hariet took off on her broom without the teacher's permission she should have punished her for it, instead of punishing the team by having her play for them. When she heard Wood's suggestion, she immediately approved. Hariet is now not allowed within 20 feet of the stadium, she even cast a shield charm to enforce her instructions."

"The school broom shed is next to the statium isn't it?" Hermione pondered.

"It is indeed, and since that is within the no-go area, Hariet can't go there either. I think it is safe to say that she will never fly again."

Hery fellt utterly crushed, and that was not simply because three girls were sitting on him. Not only was he no longer the Gryffindor Seeker, he was now not even alowed to watch any games and he couldn't even fly one of the school brooms, his most pleasurable leisure activity had been so casually and completely swepped away from him.

"Emily was there to wasn't she?" Sophie asked "Didn't she watch your session?"

"Yes, she saw the whole thing, she came back with me, and she had an very proud and satisfied look on her face. Something tells me she enjoyed herself out there in the stands. She kept congratulating me as we walked back, she was still downstairs when I came up, looking for Hariet."

"Shall we go down?" Hermione offered.

"Yes, let'" Sophie agreed "I'm sure Hariet here would like to hear her accound of things too."

She also cancelled enough of the spells for Hary to at leat be able to walk back down to the common room, although she didn't try to improve his appearance in any way.

She will not be allowed to fly a broom anywhere in Hogwarts. I'm so pleased."

Thanks brother. I owe you one."

"Now Harry" she told him then, using the shortened form of his original nam and aiming her wand in his direction "The first thing you are going to do is strip off all of your clothes except for the underwear you are wearing which was so generously donated by one of the first-year girls. "I am a girl, it is tright that I sleep with my fellow girls."

Of coruse Professor, one moment please" Emily responded, then headed upstairs to pick up the camera they had used to take their picture of Harry earlier. She was back in no more than a moment, and handed the camera over.

"Thank you, Professor"

"I believe so, professor. I know it is a lot to take on, but I feel I am up to the task."

"The ministry will have to decide in your case, but it shouldn't take long. I believe the next meeting of the adoption panel will be on Monday, and if we move quickly we can have the preliminaries sorted by then. "I don't think there'll be any difficulty in obtaining a signature from the Dursley's" Ginny noted "they hate Harry and of course they see him as a wizard,which doesn't sit right with them at all. They'll be happy to rid their home of all traces of magical influene. I'm sure of it."

"That they will" McGonagall agreed "and to move this process along, if you do get that form you can hand it to me when you have got the rest of it filled in. I'l go to Privet Drive andl obtain the Dursleys' signatures personally, then I can pass it back to the ministry for you.

"I would advise you not to tell the others until you hear back from the ministry" she advised "they may not vote in your favour, but then again they might. I know a few people on the assessment panel."

"Very well, professor and thanks again."

McGonagall then stepped out of the room and headed back downstairs, Ginny waited a few moments before she went down. Inside she was ecstatic. If she could pull this off, and from what Mcgonagall had hinted, she might then Harry would truly be her own, her power over him would be absolute.

Sophie was the next to successfully cast Lumos, and a few moments later she also managed the second spell.

A few moments later Ginny too cast both spells successfully but Emily was still struggling."

1223.content:
Ginny Weasley, 1st year Gryffindor of Hogwarts, was reevaluating her opinion of Harry Potter her first night at Hogwarts. Growing up, she had the image of Harry Potter as being this strong willed, super powered wizard who could defeat anyone in an instant, save for Dumbledore. After all, he defeated Voldemort when he was a baby, right? As a little girl, she wanted to be Harry's equal and marry him someday. Even though they were 10 years apart, she was closest to her oldest brother Bill. After he graduated from Hogwarts, he gave her all his school books from all 7 years to her to study and use at Hogwarts. Although the Defense books would likely change with the different DADA professors and she didn't have a wand to study, she read all her books so many times, she dreamt herself having a wand and practicing the movements she read in her books and making the potions as were instructed. She also dreamt of herself dueling equaling with the super-powered Harry from her dreams and him being so impressed, he would fall in love with her. To the shock of her family, she used Voldemort's name because she figured Harry would as well.

When she first met him, he had to ask her mom how to get onto Platform Nine and Three-Quarters. She herself had known that for years and been dreaming of going for years, yet Harry took his going to Hogwarts for granted by not being fully prepared. She dismissed this at the time, but then she learned from Hermione when she met her at Diagon Alley that Harry adopted Ron's laziness by not applying himself in school; her heart broke at that moment. Her dream Harry did not exist.

Then, she thought back to why he suddenly appeared at her house during the summer. Her three brothers had to rescue him in the middle of the night from his house because he was locked up and nearly starved by his own relatives. How could the Boy-Who-Lived be so easily bulled by his own Muggle relatives? If he was that defenseless, could he even defend himself against wizards and witches? Again, after talking to Hermione who learned it from Harry's own mouth, the only reason he defeated Quirrell was because of his mother's protection, which was also how he survived Voldemort as a baby. She sobbed her heart out that night in bed that Harry Potter was no super wizard, just some mediocre at best wizard who got lucky. Despite that, it did not end her ambitions of being the top of her year, Prefect, Head Girl, and the most powerful witch in the world.

Speaking of that day in Diagon Alley, she did not have to get secondhand stuff to the shock of her family. She stayed in contact with Bill, who she loved very much (and Bill loved her very much too), he even sent enough money for Ginny to get new school supplies (even an owl) and the new DADA books (although she could tell they were rubbish so she vowed to continue learning from Bill's DADA books as well). At Flourish and Blotts, she saw Lucius Malfoy grab one of her Lockhart books and throw it back in her basket. That night, she saw what appeared to be a diary in that particular Lockhart book. Not trusting it due to Malfoy, she sent it with a note to Dumbledore using her new owl, which she named Billie since it is the female version of Bill, her favorite brother. She got a reply back saying it was a dark diary that once belonged to Tom Marvolo Riddle, the teenage Voldemort, and that it was destroyed. She was also told that her future house would get 100 points at the beginning of the school year and a Special Services Award for preventing a great tragedy happening via the diary. She glowed with happiness at stopping Malfoy and Voldemort indirectly.

She then thought back to the morning and how Harry and Ron stole her father’s car to Hogwarts after not being able to get on the train. They were so stupid that they didn’t use Harry’s owl to send for help like she would have done. They were also spotted by Muggles and got the car wrecked; talk about losers. Growing up with Ron, she expected it from him and did not look down on him, but Harry was different since she used to have him on a pedestal.

She was so disappointed in Harry that she decided that she was going to make him feel inferior to her. If she couldn’t have Harry Potter as her equal and husband, then she’d control him so dominantly that he may as well be her slave.

“Oh hello, Ginny. You startled me” said Harry after he jumped at hearing her.

He gave me all 7 years of his schoolbooks when he graduated as well as extra advanced books these past couple years that would work well as resources which I have brought with me. What do you say?” smiled Ginny back at Harry.

“I said get off!” yelled Harry, ignoring Ginny’s offer.

“That’s it!” yelled Ginny as she leaned her head back so fast, she butted heads with Harry’s forehead.

“Ouch! That hurts” said Harry.

“I’m not done yet” said Ginny. She then grabbed both of Harry’s arms and then pulled them forward so fast, that she heard Harry’s shoulders pop.

“Ow! My shoulders!”

Ginny then for good measure rammed her elbow right into his stomach three times. She heard Harry moan as his head fell forward on her shoulder. She smiled at the pain he was in. She then shifted her body a bit so that her hands were on Harry’s face. She leaned forward as if to kiss him but right before their lips met, she hacked a bit and spit some phlegm right into his mouth.

“Swallow” Ginny ordered. Harry looked at her in fear and did as he was told. Ginny laughed at her victory.

“Please, Ginny. No more” begged Harry.

“Wow, that’s all you can handle from me? You really are pathetic, huh Harry? Fine, that’s all for tonight” said Ginny as she shrugged her shoulders and got off Harry. “Good night” said Ginny in a sing-song voice as she went back to her dorm in a happy mood.

122312.content:
Ginny woke up early the next morning in a good mood, remembering what she did to Harry the night before. ‘I wonder how much homework he got done last night’ Ginny thought. ‘Maybe he passed out after I left and he didn’t get any done. That would be hilarious.’

She then got cleaned up for her first day of school and went to the Gryffindor Common Room. She smiled when she saw him in the exact same position as she left him. There were no written parchments so that told her he got no homework done. She smiled as she crept up to him and said “Wake up, you lazy bum!” as she punched him in the stomach.

That punch sent Harry back into the chair as he was breathing hard after getting the wind knocked out of him. He froze when he saw an angry Ginny about to hit him again.

“I’m up! I’m up!” yelled Harry. Ginny already had her fist out so she punched Harry’s right cheek for good measure.

“Get upstairs and cleaned up, you lazy bum. Breakfast will be starting soon and I don’t want to miss getting my schedule.’

Harry scrambled out of the chair and went upstairs to get cleaned up. When he got to his dorm, Ron was finishing getting cleaned up. “Where were you last night? And what happened to your face?” Harry’s right cheek looked a little red and a little blood was coming out of his lip.

Harry knew that Ron would never believe that Ginny did it so he lied. “I was just relaxing by the fire last night before I accidentally fell asleep. I guess I fell straight onto the table and I hurt myself.”

“Ouch” said Ron as he winced a bit. “Get cleaned up and we can wait for Hermione and Ginny and we’ll all go to breakfast.”

“Ginny’s already up. She saw me downstairs and woke me up actually.”

“That’s nice of her” replied Ron.

“Yeah” trailed off Harry. He then headed towards the bathroom and got cleaned up. He rubbed his cheek as it still stung but he at least stopped the bleeding. What was going on with Ginny lately? She was a sweet girl when he saw her over the summer. Shaking his head, Harry got cleaned up and then dressed as he made it downstairs where he saw Ron, Hermione, and Ginny with all their books while his stuff was spread along the table.

“Good morning, Harry” said a cheery Ginny. “I’ve noticed that your stuff is here. Did you get all your homework done?” she asked while putting Harry on the spot.

“Oh crap! I fell asleep without getting it done!” panicked Harry.

“You didn’t get it done? Come on, Harry. Even Ron got his done” said Ginny in an exasperated voice that hid her condescending meaning.

“Well the Dursleys didn’t” started Harry.

“Don’t blame others for this Harry. You spent a whole month at my and Ron’s house. You had plenty of time to get it done.”

“Ginny’s right, Harry. You have no one to blame but yourself” said Hermione in a disappointed voice.

“Well, he can do it at breakfast or something” replied Ron. “Let’s go eat!”

“Yeah!” said Ginny and Hermione.

Harry then gathered his books and was about to head out with them when Ginny interrupted him.

“Harry, can you please carry my books for me? Carrying all these books while at the same time trying to mesmerize my way to the Great Hall is a lot of work” said Ginny as she then gave a pout.

Harry figured that Ginny was actually ordering him to do it but hid it in the form of a sweet, innocent girl asking for his help. Not wanting a repeat of the night before, he merely said “Sure” as Ginny then dumped all her books in his hands which were a lot of weight when combined with his books.

“Thanks, Harry” said Ginny as she then pecked the cheek she punched earlier to keep up her appearance. “Don’t fall to behind me okay? I don’t want you falling and hurting yourself.”

‘Yeah, right. You don’t want me damaging your books by mistake is what you really mean’ thought Harry as he struggled with the weight and walked behind Ginny as he was walking at a slower pace than her. Ginny, however, also saw it as Harry’s rightful place to follow her and enjoyed it.

On the way to breakfast, people greeted Harry but he was so busy trying not to drop Ginny’s books, he didn’t listen to them.

“How are you holding up there, Harry? I could take a couple to relieve you if you want” suggested Ginny in a concerned voice.

“No, no that’s fine” replied Harry. “I’m fine.”

“If you say so. Thank you so much” said Ginny.

“Harry, you are such a gentleman, you know that? Helping out Ginny on her first day like this. I’m so proud of you” said Hermione.

“Thanks Hermione, but it’s no big deal” Harry said. Ron didn’t say a word as he was daydreaming about breakfast.

Soon enough, they made it to the Great Hall.

Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Ginny sat together at the Gryffindor table, with Harry, Ron, and Hermione sitting side by side while Ginny sat across from Harry.

“You should probably work on your homework while you eat” suggested Ginny in a concerned voice. “Some of it done is better than none after all.”

“You don’t have any homework done?!” yelled Hermione.

“”No, which is why I really need to concentrate!” yelled Harry back as he piled his plate with food while he restarted his Potions essay. Unbeknownst to them, all the professors heard them yelling and began whispering to each other, debating with one another.

Ginny, however, didn’t want him to get either done so while she was eating, she kicked him hard on the leg whenever he started to write or eat; the left knee for eating, the right knee for writing. Every time she kicked, he either said “Ouch” or tried to muffle his screams, which was then followed by a harder kick. Harry figured there would be bruising on his knees, if not scars.

“Are you okay, Harry?” asked Ginny in fake concern.

Harry knew she was playing a game but also that he wouldn’t rat her out so he replied “I think I have a stomachache.”

“A stomachache, Harry? Maybe you should go to the Hospital Wing? Madam Pomfrey can cure it in no time” suggested Hermione.

“The Hospital Wing sounds like” started Harry as Ginny interrupted with two of her hardest kicks which hurt so bad that he felt tears form in his eye.

“Sounds like not a place I need to go to, Hermione” finished Harry in a strained voice. ”Trust me. I’ll be okay.”

“If you’re sure about this, Harry” said a reluctant Hermione.’

“I’m fine” repeated Harry and the subject was dropped.

Soon after that, Neville came by to say hi before he sat with Dean and Seamus farther down the table. Ginny continued to kick Harry whenever he tried to eat or get homework done and he eventually stopped doing anything. That in turn just made Ginny kick him harder, which left no doubt anymore that there would be bruising and scarring on his legs after this. At a later time during breakfast, Professor McGonagall came by and gave everyone their schedules.

“Let’s see. We have Defense and Transfiguration today before Lunch followed by Charms. Tomorrow we have Herbology and Double History and the following day is Double Potions and Defense” said Hermione.

“What are you talking about Hermione? I have Double Potions, Lunch, and Transfiguration today” said Harry, frowning.

“Hey, so do I” said Ginny. “You must have gotten the wrong schedule by mistake.”

“Yeah, I’ll go ask Professor McGonagall” said Harry as he got up slowly, his legs killing him. Ron, Hermione, and Ginny decided to come with him because they were done eating and bored.

“Professor McGonagall, there is a mistake with my schedule” started Harry.

“There’s no mistake, Mr. Potter” said a very angry Professor McGonagall.

“Pardon? I don’t understand.”

“Let me put it a way that even you can understand, Potter” replied Snape with a sneer. “We heard you from over here that you got none of your summer homework done. This level of pure laziness is unprecedented. Sure there have been many students in the past with unfinished essays, even 1 or 2 not done at all. But never has there been an instance where a student has done NONE of the essays, Potter. If it were up to me, I’d have you expelled for this level of insubordination, but alas that’s not the case. In exchange for you remaining at Hogwarts after not doing any of your summer homework, you have to redo your 1st year again. Maybe next time you’ll rethink before skipping your homework.”

“You can’t be serious” said Harry in a quiet voice.

“I’m afraid I am, Mr. Potter. I am very disappointed in you. Your belongings have already been moved to the 1st Year Boys dorm. Good day, Mr. Potter.” said Professor McGonagall.

Harry, Hermione, Ron, and Ginny were speechless at the turn of events as they headed back to their table. Ginny was laughing inside her head; she had no idea that her actions last night would get Harry put down in her year! That would mean she’d be spending a lot more time with him.

Ron patted his shoulder and said “It’ll be okay, mate. We’ll still be best friends.”

“Do you really think so, Ron? Sure at first, you’ll try to keep things the same, but over time, you’re going to drift apart because you’ll be limited on how much time you spend with Harry” said Ginny.

“No! We’ll still be best friends, right Harry?”

“Sure Ron” sad Harry. “What about you, Hermione?”

“Sure, Harry. I’ll try but Ginny has a point that eventually we could drift apart” reasoned Hermione.

To add insult to injury, at that next moment, a Howler from Mrs. Weasley came at that moment blaming him and Ron for the car being spotted by Muggles and getting Mr. Weasley in trouble with the Ministry. Most everyone in the Hall was laughing at Ron and Harry at that point and it was time to head for the first class of the year.

The Hogwarts Express had been travelling for some time from its departure point at Kings Cross Station, steadily making its way towards Hogwarts but it would be a while yet before it arrived. In one of the compartments sat Harry Potter, Hermione Granger, Ron Weasley and a scruffy looking man that Hermione had identified as Professor R. J. Lupin.

All of a sudden though, the train started to slow down, and eventually it stopped. Ron asked what was going on, but Hermione and Harry shook their heads for they didn't have a clue. As for Lupin, he was clearly asleep and was in no position to offer a response. From the sudden increase in background noise and far off voices, it appeared that this group weren't the only ones who were asking questions.

Then the lights went out, plunging the train into darkness.
In the confusion, their compartment door entered and footsteps came closer. Then harry suddenly felt a weight on top of him, somebody was sitting on him; he assumed it was unintentional.

"Not here, I am here" he informed the unknown someone.
"Yes Harry, I know" a familiar voice responded, then giggled. It was a female voice.
"Ginny? Get off me!"
"No Harry, this is far too good an opportunity to just pass up" she remained seated.

A shadow, a sudden chill, ice spreading across the windows. There was a presence, an ominous and threatening presence nearby. The compartment door opened again, something dark and hooded entered and started to make a sucking noise, as though sucking the air, or something worse out of the vicinity. Harry felt voices, a woman's voice, a male, a scream, darkness.

She checked his pulse at regular intervals. She knew she could perform CPR if necessary, she hoped it wouldn't be needed. There was always the chance it wouldn't work.

She felt his pulse fading, it would stop any moment now.

Finally she arose and looked down at the boy.

His eyes were blank and unresponsive, almost dead. There was no sign of comprehension on his face.

She felt for a pulse, checked his breathing. Both were fine. Fred was alive, but his vacant face seemed to suggest that whatever he was, perhaps it wasn't Fred any more.

She walked around him, his eyes did not follow them. If they moved at all, it was a vague, he didn't appear to even be looking anywhere. Whatever movement was left in his eyes was entirely unccoordinated - as though he no longer knew how to control the muscles which directed them.

She lifted him to his feet but he collapsed immediately. He did not even know how to stand, he had lost all control over his movement.

Whenever any sound came from him it was gutteral, a single tone, meaningless. He could not only not contol his eyes and could not stand. He could not speak either. He was completely unaware of himself or his surroundings.

He was alive, for sure but in all other respects he was gone. Whatever Fred had been, was no longer present in that husk of a form. He was no longer even a sentient being, for while he was conscious, there was no intelligence behind those eyes, no self awareness left within him. Whatever had made him a thinking, acting boy was no longer there. His essence, his soul as some call it had been extinguished.

Hermione snatched the boy's wand, snapped it in half and threw it in the fire. It would be of no use to him any more.

Hermione's fast and agile mind considered the two options available to her in only a few moments; whether to let George to take Fred to the Hospital Wing even though it would be futile, or whether to simply offer George the same choice, and the same consequence should he choose unwisely.

She knew that letting George take Fred up to the Hospital Wing would serve no useful purpose, it would simply confirm that his twin was beyond all hope, and as George was so close to his brother, he would continue to demand answers until he started to become a pain. She did not need an unfettered George snooping where he had no business looking.

The other option was far more appetising, She would present George with the same two options, and then she would either have a willing plaything or another mindless nobody. Either way, George would no longer be a problem and she had to admit that she did love the feel of a boy smothering under her ass.

George was so worked up, he was almost waiting for her to make her move; and move she did.
The boy didn't even notice the Expelliarmus that sent his wand flying across the room, Her second spell sent ropes shooting out of her wand, these ropes wrapped themselves around her target, binding him securely.

It was only when she came forward and appled pressure to to his chest with his right hand that George finally realised that something strange was going on. "What are you doing, Hermione?" he asked her as his trussed-up body fell to the floor.

Hermione came forward and squatted over George's face, her knees either side of his shoulders. She did not need to pin George's arms down as she had done with Fred, his arms were bound tightly to his sides. That was better in a way, she could focus all of her presence upon the boy's face.

"Claiming my seat" Hermione explained as she allowed her butt and her young womanhood to claim his mouth and nose respectively. "My second seat actually" she added, bringing her full weight to bear upon his face "Fred was the first."

Two realisations hit George at that point. Firstly, with Hermione sitting so fully upon his face, he could not breathe at all. Secondly, it was Hermione who had done that to his brother, and now was the same thing about to happen to him. The colour drained from his face is the truth of his perilous situation struck home. He wanted to ask her 'why' but with no air able to enter or leave his mouth, no sound could escape his lips.

Hermione relaxed again and sat even more firmly upon the face beneath her skirt. She would not turn him into a vegetable just yet, the ultimatum would come soon enough, but if he didn't then surrender himself to her, he would indeed share his brother's fate. He would get one chance, and one alone.

It took a little while to smother George to almost unconsciousness, but when she knew he was about to pass out, she lifted herself off his face only slightly.

"This is your only choice, George" she advised him as the boy gasped in desperately needed gulps of air with Hermione's butt still dangerously close to his face "either surrender yourself to me and give your life entirely to my service, or continue to smother until you have no more of a mind than Fred."

It would be highly pleasurable for her to destroy George's awareness as she had done with Fred. She had done it once before, she could do it again. She would recognise the signs, The would know when the moment came, she would wait for it and not stop smothering the boy until it happened. All he had to do was refuse her now and it would happen.

"Now before I begin, I think the fat lady should join us" Hermione pointed out "but she'll need a place of her own." Hermione waved her wand at the wall and a large painting of a field of sheep appeared there.

"Excuse me a moment" she told the girls" then went to the entrance and spoke with the Fat Lady for a few moments. The other girls heard hermione giggling for a moment, but then she came back into the room.

"Oh that is just perfect" she chuckled "she had invited that dimwitted knight from that corridor near the Divination Classroom, Sir Cadogan... she had invited him into her paiting. He was laying on all fours and the fat lady was sitting on his back."

A moment later, the fat lady wandered into the painting Hemrione had created. She nodded aprreciatively when she saw where many of the girls were sitting.

"Okay girls, and lady" Hermione added "today begins a new order in Gryffindor tower. From now on, all the boys are ours to do with as we please. This state of affairs will continue forever. The boys will all surrender their wands to us. They are no longer entitled to learn magic. We will use regular confundus charms to make sure the boys forget any magic they might have accidentally learned. Those of us who do not yet know the charm, will be shown by those girls who are competent with it."

"You all know that Sarah's boy is no longer the Head Boy and not a prefect. He will not be replaced. From today, Gryffindor will be given two female prefects, and I believe the role of Head Boy should be discontinued completely. As for the other houses, they are free to do as they wish of course but I do think it would be enjoyable for their girls if we encouraged them to follow our example.

"How about when new girls and boys are sorted into Gryffindor?" one of the girls asked.

"The girls will join us of course" Hermione added "we will encourage them to each take their own picks from the new boys, and to ensure that no boy remains unclaimed."

"Those who are claimed will remain the property of the girl who owns them" Hermione added "we can gift our boys to each other, but we may not take a boy who is already taken. We can invite other girls to use our boys, on our own terms of course. The boy remains under control of the girl who owns him though, even if she shares him with many other girls."

"The boys' dormitory will be stripped of all of its beds" she continued "boys are not entitled to sleep in beds any more. Their trunks and all their possessions will pass into the ownership of whichever girl he belongs to. His Gringotts key will also pass to her, and a letter will be sent to the bank, advising the goblins of the change of ownership of his account." The moment she said this, a number of girls felt that another key had magically entered their pockets.

"The boys will have new trunks" Hermione added "just as Cassie's boy has already. These will also have compartments large enough for the boy to fit inside. This is where they sleep, they key will be ours. Each trunk will bear the boy's own name. We can lock our boys inside whenever we want, and let them out at our convenience. Each boy, as he passes into our ownership will lose the right to a name of his own."

"Now for the fat lady" Hermione added, talking directly to the painting.

"Do you approve of the new order in Gryffindor tower?"

"Absolutely" the woman nodded "I have always believed that men were inferior to women, you saw that brainless oaf outside."

"Indeed, it was a highly entertaining scene. We do have a favour to ask of you though."

"I can't bring real boys into my painting."

"Of course not, but I do think it is time that Gryffindor tower should have a new password don't you? One that is known only to the girls. After each year's sorting, this password shall be passed to the new girls at the table by the head girl, with strict instructions that no boy should ever hear it. If you hear a Gryffindor girl arriving with a boy in tow, you will let her whisper the password in your ear so she doesn't reveal it to the boy."

"That will work" the Fat Lady added "I thought you would suggest I let them in anyway, but there are ways for a witch to look like someone she is not."

"I know, I've read about Polyjuice Poton," Hermione did not mention she had brewed the stuff last year.

"The new password will be... " Hermione smiled "boys are chairs"

"Thank you, fat lady. That is all I ask of you."

"I'll have to clear this all with Professor McGonagall of course" the fat lady added "I'll visit her painting in her office before I return to my own. I will give you her response when I get back. With that the fat lady wandered out of the painting.

"I wanted to talk with you about your boyfriend, Percy Weasley."

She waited, still seated on Harry as the shop assistant worked. "Are you sure you can afford all these?" the assistant asked as that point.

"He'll authrorise the payment from his Gringotts vault" Hermione pointed out.

"Yes, governess."

If the professor wrote down instructions in a lesson, or advised students to read from a book or do homework, all these tasks would be beyond Harry's ability. As he could still sign his name though, he could still give permission for Hermione to make payments from his vault. She confirmed this with one additional instruction.

"You may not withdraw funds from Gringotts vault 687, nor can you make payments from that vault without my express permission."

"Yes, Governess."

Lily,

I can tell that your father's job change is due to you somehow. When I was nine, I felt powerless sometimes, being the youngest in such a huge family and spending most of my days with my mother who was controlling while Dad was at work and my brothers, except for Ron, were at Hogwarts or already left home. I would have loved to somehow usurp some powr within my family.

You see, after spending so much time with the all-female Quidditch team, the Holyhead Harpies, I wondered if I made the right decision to get married so young. A couple of my teammates are in a relationship with each other and seeing them makeout with each other makes me a bit curious at least. Another teammate of mine has asked me out a few times and so far I have turned her down due to me still being married and not wanting to lead her on. But it has made me question whether I was still in love with your father or not.

Having said all that, my biggest concern was our family. It wouldn't be fair to you or your brothers to tear up the family due to my own doubts. However, you have solved that by taking control of your father with me gone and I couldn't feel more proud of you and feel more relaxed as well.

My only question is what is the new relationship between you two? My gut feeling tells me that as the second Lily Potter, you have taken the role of Harry's mother. I am also wondering if his new job is real or if he's somhow reduced himself mentally to that of a young child and he is staying there as another child. If that is the case, that would alone be cause for me to file for divorce; I don't want to be married to someone who sees themself as a young child.

If my guess is right, how would you like to really become Harry's mother? At the same time I'm getting divorce papers ready, I can also have some adoption papers drawn up as well for you to adopt Harry. This can be done discreetly;all the public will need to know is that your father and I will be divorcing, but still live together for the sake of you and your brothers.

You don't have to answer right away. I know it's a lot to take in. But just know that I am not angry with you. In fact I feel proud of you.

I love you.

Ginny


When Lily was done reading, she couldn't believe what she had read. Her mother had guessed correctly on the new relationship between her father and herself and that she was okay with it? She felt a huge weight lift off her shoulders.
